reviews.text: Checked in at 6:05 for a 6:15 reservation which was made via Yelp.  Checked on the status three times and was told each time our table was just being cleared.  We were finally seated a little before 7.  Why bother with reservations if they don&#39;t actually mean anything?  Food and service were good once we finally got to our table.

Worst pick up experience ever. Text me order was ready at 732 waiting in long car line got to the front of bldg at 755 they ask name 15 min later approx 810 worker says the manager is trying to find u your order part of it is missing. 830 another worker asks me to pull up I replied no sorry ia have been siting her since 755 with no explanation of the status of my paid order. 830 worker comes back can you move up now I am angry 835 waited over q and a half hour while 30 to 40 othe r people received their order i said just cancel my order this is ridiculous. OK no problem. Whatever he replied. No where else open . Horrible.  They ruined my mothers day dinner with my 7 children shame on you cheesecake factory Peabody Ma

I ordered from Cheesecake Factory in Peabody last night. I understand times are tough but my living situation just changed and my only option was take out. I ordered orange chicken which I always get at other locations (In Boston) with white rice. It was ready early, great. One bite into the white rice it tasted fishy. I have severe allergies with fish. I&#39;m not sure if they serve sushi, or had the same scooper as something they use with fish also for the rice mound. Second bite tasted like the ocean or seaweed. I have been up all night now getting sick as it was for sure an allergic reaction. This is the second time I&#39;ve had food cross contaminated from this location. Sorry won&#39;t be ordering again. Luckily I used my epi-pen and didn&#39;t have to be seen via ER with this covid-19 filling them up.<br><br>I don&#39;t appreciate the automatic, fill out our survey response. I&#39;ve waisted enough time and risked my health cheesecake has heard enough from my commentary above.
This is my favorite of all chain restaurants. I don&#39;t think any of the other ones to compare. My favorite thing is a miso Salmon in the avocado eggrolls.

Awful social distancing where you have to check in in the small vestibule, embarrassingly awful, I don&#39;t know why they don&#39;t utilize their larger foyer or have it outside with tape where each party should stand and wait 6ft apart. I had pretty good service. I was very unhappy with my meal. &#34;Four cheese pasta no chicken.&#34; It had chicken and I&#39;m a vegetarian, also they were out of penne which makes the dish I wish I had known before I ordered and could have gotten something else. The pasta it came with was so chewy and couldn&#39;t eat any pieces that were touching the chicken which was mixed in and hidden. Disappointing usually I love this place.

I scheduled a reservation for 5 people for 6:00pm. We all get to the restaurant, check in at the desk and they tell us that the people who are at our booth have not left yet, but they would text us when our table was ready. Meanwhile, there were many other open tables, but okay. I figured they had one large table reserved for larger parties. We were not seated until 6:45, which was frustrating in itself. Come to find out, they shoved all 5 of us in a small booth! We didn&#39;t appreciate being on top of each other, especially during COVID. It was like we couldn&#39;t even move. We ask to move to a larger table with chairs, the man at the bar said he wasn&#39;t sure there were any open (meanwhile, we were looking at about 10 open tables). Another waitress comes over, we ask her if we can sit outside on the patio, to which she says &#39;The patio is closed.&#39; with an attitude. There were people eating on the patio! At that point, we got up an left. On our way out we noted that tables of people were bunched up, NOT 6 feet apart. Meanwhile, half the restaurant was empty! Why have people sitting so close to each other? Horrible wait time, horrible service.

My favorite chain restaurant does it again, offers a delicious meal, mouth watering cheesecake, and attentive service. <br><br>I went out on a limb and ordered the coconut lime chicken curry. It was delicious. I was almost licking the sauce off of my plate. Thankfully, I had the house bread to help me out.<br><br>I ordered the 30th anniversary cheesecake which was layered with plain cheesecake and chocolate cake. Not my favorite option, but I&#39;m not complaining. <br><br>The downside is that they were not accepting reservations and therefore, our party of 6 waited one hour in the lobby while everyone else was being sat.

Whenever i can afford it... I come to the cheesecake factory. <br>Yes, the wait lines are a pain in the but. Yes, you need to save like 3 month in advance to be able to affors it BUT, the service is good and the food is great. At least you know there&#39;s someone cooking your food and not putting it on the microwave because it has been already premade and frozen.

We made a reservation in October at 5pm and requested the patio and spoke to someone the night before the reservation to make sure we have a spot on the patio. We did not get to sit until 5:45pm and were told patio was closed. However there were other people sitting outside and dining on the patio so I don&#39;t understand why. So finally we sit at our table. The food is overpriced and the servers have no idea what allergies are. I ordered the impossible bolognese vegan and gluten free. When the server brought my food I asked if this was the vegan one and they said yes. I started eating it and then a few minutes later a different lady came out with my pasta and said &#34;sweetie no this is your food not what you are eating now&#34;. I have a dairy sensitivity so they are so lucky I wasn&#39;t severely allergic to any of the things I said no to. I did get a bad stomach ache for the rest of the night and the next day. I got stared at by every employee for the rest of the time there, the girl who lied and said it was vegan never apologized. The manager at least came over to check in. They did not comp my food they messed up I had to ask for them to remove it off the check. Worst place I&#39;ve ever been to. We were celebrating 2 of my friends birthdays and it was my first time there. I will NEVER be going back to Cheesecake Factory ever! And I recommend anyone with an allergy should not go since the managers don&#39;t educate their staff on what food allergies are and how important it is. If you have no allergies and wanna spend a lot of money you might like the food. Servers please learn the food you are serving, it&#39;s very important since it can cost someone&#39;s life and ruin their day. Us customers want to go out for a nice good meal and do NOT receive that. Also server was super slow and barely showed up at the table.

A very hard working waitstaff just couldn&#39;t overcome the Saturday night crowd to provide us with a timely table, drinks, food and bill. The one bench couldn&#39;t accommodate the crowd, so there wasn&#39;t enough seating for my handicapped mother and son suffering from a very painful leg hematoma and on crutches. CF wasn&#39;t our first choice, but it was Lucy&#39;s 7th birthday and her vote was non-negotiable. <br><br>Our dishes were ambrosial. My Thai chicken with brown rice included shiitake mushrooms and a sauce that took my breath away.  Mother said her chicken riesling was delicious. The cheesecake was light and fluffy. We counted at least 8 groups having &#39;Happy Birthday&#34; sung to them - it must be Beverly birthday central.<br><br>Why three stars? Two of our party who shared the carrot cake and whipped cream had explosive tummy issues that night. Minus 3 for that issue and the overwhelmed staff and reservation refusal policy, not to mention a menu so confusing that it lists items twice under different categories. <br><br>They do deserve one additional star for all the birthday boys and girls who choose The Cheesecake Factory to celebrate their important day. That&#39;s worth something.

I decided to take my mom here for and early lunch. Place is very nice. We were seated right away, ordered our drinks, my mom got a soda, I got a water and also the strawberry creamsicle &#34;spiked&#34; drink. We we got the drinks as I was drinking my strawberry creamsicle i was crunching on something at the bottom, which at first appeared to be rock sugar, then my teeth started to hurt and I thought my tooth had broke cause the sound was NoT as if I was chewing sugar. Apparently the was pieces of glass at the bottom of my drink. The server offered to replace the drink with a new one and said he would take it off the bill, then when we got the bill it was there. Very disappointing.. I may need to go to the hospital because my teeth and gums hirt mo<br><br>Update: contacted customer services as they had asked. And still nothing. You figure they would be on top of this due to their high standards!

This is for the North Shore Mall Peabody location.  Horrible service.  Called in for them to drop to my car.  Waited an extra 15 minutes past the time they promised it and finally went in to pick it up.  No one at desk so waited longer.  No apology, nothing.  Driving out of the mall I reached into bag to grab a fry and it was ICE COLD.<br>Got home, tried the burger and it pretty bad.  Had a funny taste part of the way through it.<br>This is just a warning to others.  GO somewhere else!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Waited 1 hour &amp; 1/2  for our food for two people and when we got our food it was cold, the steak wasn&#39;t well done it was rare.

For an enormous restaurant made even more famous by the Big Bang Theory, the Cheesecake Factory surprised us with a varied and very good menu.  The chopped salad had grilled chicken and avocado and the vinaigrette dressing was quite tasty.  My wife raved about the Tuscany chicken which had a substantial amount of chicken and asparagus.  The wait staff was efficient and the bread was fresh.<br>Again, for a huge and busy place, they make going to the mall a desirable experience.  We will return.

My mother really likes this place but honestly, I&#39;m not much of a fan. Their menu is huge which makes me wonder how freshly made the food really is. The real reason to visit is the cheesecake. They&#39;ve got an amazing selection.<br>We went for lunch and I was really disappointed. My mother went with regular spaghetti and meatballs and it was great (tried some of hers as I couldn&#39;t eat mine). I tried the chicken and biscuit dish and it was terrible. The sauce tasted weird, the veggies were not even thoroughly cooked and the chicken tasted rotten. I ate maybe two bites and decided I didn&#39;t want to get sick. Our waiter was nice about it and to their credit they took it off of the bill but I don&#39;t think I&#39;d trust buying another meal there.<br>We did get cheesecake for dessert. It&#39;s good but overpriced. I went with the lemon raspberry. Very good. My mother got a celebration one and it was huge. She liked it but couldn&#39;t eat all of it (she took it home). <br>Very long wait for seriously mediocre food. I didn&#39;t like being seated near the waiter station either as I got to hear a waiter describe to a new waiter how much it all sucked and what kind of customers to avoid. Maybe discuss that away from customers?

I could write endless reviews about all the food from here because every time I come I try a new entree and cheesecake. I&#39;m deciding to write a review now to talk about their flatbread pizza. People may be skeptical about it from here, but I really enjoyed the fresh basil, tomato, and mozzarella flatbread. The seasonings on top were really nice except it was a little bit too salty (probably because of the fontina and mozzarella cheese combo+the seasoning), but I still enjoyed it. I usually ask for pizzas well done, but I forgot and will make sure to next time even though the crust still had a crunchy bite to it. My boyfriend got the New York steak and he said he LOVED it; I can confirm this because I had a bite lol. <br>Moving onto dessert. We shared the lemon meringue cheesecake and it was perfect. So light and creamy and the lemon flavor was great and tangy. I loved the torched part on top.

The food is awesome but the customer service is a flipping joke. I called in for a pick up and the girl on the phone puts me on hold for 15:29 minutes . Sorry but no place is THAT busy on take out to not Atleast take my order and tell me it&#39;s going to be an hour or longer . The girl that I  finally ordered from seemed so annoyed and rude  . I was so annoyed that my husband went in to see if I was being irrational and maybe they were really busy ... he said there were 4-6 people just sitting there taking to one another . Really good  food but I&#39;d rather order from some place else that actually cares about the customer
I went there got a 30 dollar meal tipped them 3 dollars then I went to my billing and it said I owed them 2,000,000

The wait was a little long but that was expected on a Saturday night . After about and hour wait we were finally sat . Our waitress was nice but very forgetful and  inattentive.We were greeted right away and took our drink order at that time we put in an appetizer right away .. after a hour wait we were quite hungry. Well 10-15 minutes later when the waitress came back to take our order asked if we would like to start with an appetizer? Umm we ordered one 10-15 minutes ago she stated oh yes no worries I put that in ...30 minutes later the appetizer arrived .Our entrée came out about 30 minutes later . The food runner dropped our food off , our waitress never came back to check on us I had to ask the runner for knives, salt and pepper and water because our waitress never came back until we were ready for boxes and a check, The food was hot and delicious but the service was terrible.It was like drop and go and here is the check ! Don&#39;t get me started about the bakery decided to grab 2 cheesecakes to go 20 minutes later ... seriously!! Very Disappointing and Disorganized!!! Staff was more interested in socializing. Won&#39;t be back anytime soon!
Got take out, drove all the way home to find a huge dead moth-like bug on the lettuce.

My family and I came for a Sunday dinner, and what a busy evening it was! Despite the craziness  inside, our server was very attentive and friendly. If  you can request to have Kevin as your server. He made  our experience! Kevin always approached us with a warm smile. He came to the table while we were telling a story in Spanish and provided the perfect  response in our culture. It made us feel more comfortable and ready to enjoy the phenomenal food! Thank you for a wonderful dinner experience, Kevin!

My daughter &amp; I went to the CF for lunch. So many choices! My daughter had the chicken parm sandwich with standard French Fries. I ordered the Cubano sandwich.  I was very excited about my selection! For my side item a house salad; I upgraded to make that a Greek salad by requesting feta cheese &amp; kalamata olives.  I was accommodated with plenty of each for a modest upcharge.   I highly recommend the Cubano - pork was so moist and delicious.  The amount of Swiss cheese, pickles &amp; mustard was a perfect ratio.  My daughter was very pleased with her chicken parm sandwich.  I&#39;m looking forward to my next visit to the Cheesecake Factory!   Our waiter, Cristian, was excellent &amp; super accommodating.

Came here today with my sister&#39;s family and my family. I was the first to order and last to get mine. When my food came out my plate was hotter than my food. Food was luke warm. Disappointed that you spend a lot of money for quality food and this is what happens. Stick to selling Cheese Cake because at least that won&#39;t bother people when it comes out cold.

This location is my favorite one. The waiting time isn&#39;t long. The customer service is always good. Quick service and always on top with refilling your drinks. I always got the Louisiana chicken pasta. The fried chicken is seasoned just right and always crunchy. The sauce is absolutely amazing. The portion is always huge! Their chicken Marsala is great too. The sauce isn&#39;t too heavy but perfect. Ohh and their fries are delicious too. Always crispy and fried perfectly. I always have to order a side plate of their fries whenever I am here. Only if their prices are a little on the lower side then I would come here every week just for their awesome Louisiana chicken pasta.

I really love this place. Specially sitting at the bar. Always get good service. Food is great. Only reason I can&#39;t give it the 5th star is the lack of options for vegans. Come on guys. A good tofu dish???

So a disappointing experience, actually a better word would be aggravating. My wife and I stopped by for dinner the other night and I always get the same thing &#34;bang bang chicken and shrimp&#34;. The waitress was great but when the food came it tasted off. I realized that there were chunks of apples and apple sauce in it which has never been in it before. The waitress wanted to double check and when the manager finally came over she told me that the dish was supposed to have apple sauce in it and they just didn&#39;t crush them enough and that&#39;s why there  were chunks of apples in it. She asked if I wanted them to remake it without the apple sauce but since my wife was almost done I just had them remake it to go. When I got home I tried some and it tasted perfect (no apples). I looked at the menu online and there are no apples or sauce in this dish. So the manager came over and didn&#39;t want to admit they made a mistake and made me feel as if I was stupid and didn&#39;t know what I was ordering. Like I said really aggravating. With dinner drinks and dessert I paid over $100 for a dinner for this woman to treat me like I didn&#39;t know what I ordered.

I went there last Saturday  for lunch <br>It was pretty packed<br>We sat down in near bar areas <br>Our waiter took our orders then  after that  he disappeared  I wasn&#39;t sure what happened then we had other waiter there was no communication that he left <br>Service was lacking that day <br>Foods was okay not great  <br>Needs lots of improvement  in Service and dealing with deaf people

Such an extensive menu of meals and drinks. I can never decide what to order. It&#39;s beyond pages and pages. <br><br>The ambience and decor sets a nice mood, although I&#39;m not one for the extra dim lighting. I get the whole romantic vibe but I would really prefer to not eat my dinner in the dark. <br><br>Service is usually a hit or miss. Sometimes they&#39;re on point while others including my visit last night was terrible. We waited an extra 30 mins or so for our meals after finishing our app. By the time dinner arrived I no longer wanted it. I would&#39;ve gotten desert but I was afraid I&#39;d have to wait an eternity for it as well.<br><br>Plenty of parking. You will most likely struggle during the mall rush though. Prices are on the higher side but the portions are huge.
They get the 2 stars for SA on tap no starts for food. Ordered a pepperoni flat bread. What I got was a misshaped pizzia not a flat bread

Waited 40 mins for our food to come out despite the restaurant being empty and it came out cold. We didn&#39;t even receive everything we ordered even 10 mins of having the first few things come out. Took forever for our server to come to the table so we could tell him it was cold, he took everything back and sent the manager over who basically said I can heat it up for you. We said no and left after sitting there for 45 mins with just water. He didn&#39;t even offer to buy a dessert or do anything to make us think about coming back. Won&#39;t be returning.
Love this place! Awesome kids menu. Largest kids pizza ever (really too big!) Wish I had taken a picture.
All I&#39;m gonna say is: order the nachos extra crispy and request CARLOS for your server! Pure man! Great service!
Great food and Best service we&#39;ve ever had. Wayne was amazing and made our night so special. We will definitely be back !!

I love the Cheesecake Factory because of its menu and it&#39;s cocktails but this location goes above and beyond. Mike the bartender is so attentive and makes the best espresso martinis!!! Gary the manager was so accommodating and made sure our meals and experience were top notch. I highly recommend going in and giving them all your business because you will not only get a PERFECT experience but you&#39;ll get the best of the best service. <br><br>Thank you for always giving me a reason to come back!!!!!

Always good service, the food is pretty good. I prefer the appetizers, weekend Brunch and the cheesecakes. Nothing is amazing but everything is flavorful and they are accommodating to changes to the order.

We had a great family meal at Cheesecake tonight. I know the portions are very large, so I wouldn&#39;t let me son order an appetizer. We loved their warm bread, though. My daughter&#39;s full-size salad was massive, as expected. She took half home because she enjoyed it. I got the Skinny Chopped salad. It was just right along with the bread and to save room for dessert. Initially my son was overwhelmed by the number of menu items. He settled on the Mac and Cheese burger. Pretty cool choice. We shared a couple of slices of cheesecake. I preferred the lemon raspberry variety over the chocolate chip.<br>Our services was very good. We dined outside. The view wasn&#39;t much, but it was great weather.

Had good fettuccine alfredo the first time I came here. The large menu is what I appreciate because they have tacos, steak, pasta, pizza, hamburgers, everything. I&#39;m not a fan of cheesecake but I&#39;ve had their fudge cake and tiramisu and both were very good. Last night when I went, our service was good despite the slightly long wait.

My son and I had dinner at the bar last weekend. It was the usual busy. But not craZy. I had a couple drinks. We both had dinner and desert. The food tasted ok not great but not bad. The bar service however was terrible. The two guys were more interested in picking up dates than waiting on us. Never checked on us

Extremely busy even on a Sunday night at 8pm. The parking lot was pitch black -- none of the parking lot lights were working -- kinda dangerous. Noise levels inside were ultra loud. A lot of the lights in the restaurant were also not working which made the place feel unmaintained. Most of the food was good but the French fries were actually some of the worst I&#39;ve tasted (on par with Burger King fries)

Service was very slow. Our server was fine but was helpless to make the kitchen move any faster. Even drinks were slow in arriving.  After a seemingly endles wait for our meals, my order of Fish Tacos was cold. In full disclosure my son and grandson&#39;s steaks were fine, served at  proper temperature and were very tasty. Should have known better. my daughter and her mother were there last summer and experienced similar problems with the service.

Still amazing!  This may be &#34;just a chain&#34; but the food is great (Louisiana Chicken pasta, Cajun Jambalaya pasta, Avocado egg rolls, and the Ultimate Red Velvet cheesecake are highly recommended, but I&#39;ve honestly never had a bad dish here) and the service is the best which is what keeps me coming back.  I&#39;ve never had a rude host or server here and on my most recent visit during Saturday peak there was apparently a long wait for us after we ordered our apps but I honestly didn&#39;t even notice until the manager, Amanda, came to our table and apologized for the wait explaining that they were catching up on orders in the kitchen.  She was kind and courteous and offered to bring us more drinks and bread which not a lot managers make the effort to do at other chains unless a customer complains but the fact that she took the initiative to come to our booth tucked away in the corner of the restaurant was much appreciated.  The food ended up coming right after she left anyways so we weren&#39;t waiting for much longer.  Keep up the great work!

This was my first time at a Cheesecake Factory in over 15 years. We were told the wait for a party of seven would be 60-80 minutes. We decided to wait because it was a Saturday evening and figured we&#39;d wait anywhere. After an hour and a half, we still hadn&#39;t been seated and when we asked, were told that we had been assigned a table and when the current guests were done, we&#39;d been seated. At this point we&#39;d already seen people come in after us and we&#39;re now watching them leave. Finally after an hour and 50 minutes were were seated at a booth for six people and they brought a chair up to the end of the table. They didn&#39;t even provide a table large enough for all of us. I ordered a chicken mango avacado salad which was good but had no avacado. Overall, this experience was very disappointing and I would not go back.

Cheesecake factory has been one of my go to restaurants for a few years. Due to a recent experience I&#39;m going to be limiting my time spent at the cheesecake factory. After ordering our food it took about 45 minutes for it to come out, and it wasn&#39;t that busy in there. My Margherita pizza came out completely burnt and not even cut. After our meal, we ordered cheesecake. After about 15 to 20 minutes of waiting for the cheesecake they got our orders completely wrong which we didn&#39;t notice until we got home. Very disappointed.

This review was based on a take out only and it was just Cheesecake. Although I&#39;ve come here and other locations many different times I&#39;ve either forgotten or wasn&#39;t a Yelper at the time. I&#39;ve always enjoyed the Cheesecake Factory it&#39;s decent it&#39;s not expensive and I love Cheesecake. Only thing I hate is they put the calories on the menu I don&#39;t like that I don&#39;t like it one bit !!! Listen I know there&#39;s a lot of calories in Cheesecake but damn do you have to remind me of what a glutton I am lol. We were out doing errands Saturday afternoon which turned into early evening and was craving something sweet was either ice cream or cheesecake and cheesecake won. We were gonna sit down and grab a quick bite to eat then get dessert with coffee but I obviously have never been in there on a Saturday evening about 6:30-7pm the place was packed we asked how long wait was and was a bit longer than I felt like waiting so I decided to grab a couple slices to go. God I could&#39;ve gotten at least another 2 and ate them easily but thank God I didn&#39;t cause the calorie count would&#39;ve been absolutely staggering. I got a slice of celebration cheesecake 1st time trying it definitely won&#39;t be my last and my go to vanilla bean both with whipped cream. Both slices were absolutely delicious and writing this now and thinking about them I feel like driving there now for same order

Ok, I&#39;m not super into writing reviews, but I had the strangest experience here last night. Ordered the spicy buffalo chicken sandwich. They forgot to put  on the buffalo sauce. No big deal. The waitress apologized, took it away, and said they&#39;d remake it. Less than a minute later a different server brings me a sandwich. It&#39;s my sandwich I had just sent back...except mangled. I opened it up, and it&#39;s the same plain chicken again, except they turned the chicken breast upside down to hide the toppings I had already put on, squirted it with a few drops of buffalo sauce, and smashed the top bun back on. Totally not okay. I was honestly kind of shocked.   Told the waitress who got the manager. Manager comes over, apologizes and says she is embarrassed. I ordered something different (by this time the person I was eating with had already finished their meal). My &#34;replacement&#34; meal was fine. When we got the bill, they had still charged us for my replacement meal I had to get after the original sandwich debacle. They sent us home with a tiny piece of free cheesecake as consolation. Anyways, long story short, won&#39;t be returning to this mess.

I now live in Seacoast, NH and I had not been to the Cheesecake Factory in Peabody, MA since 2015.  <br><br>My two girlfriends and I met there today for a Christmas lunch.  The <br>AST time I was there I had a delicious dish: Large Shrimp Sautéed with Tomatoes, Lemon, Garlic, Herbs and Fresh Basil on Top of Angel Hair Pasta with a Touch of Marinara Sauce.  We all ordered this dish.  First it was not what was printed online.  It did not have marinara.  It had a lemon cream sauce.  The angel hair was a small portion.  It was cold and stuck together I a ball and the shrimp has so much breadcrumb batter you cold not find the shrimp.  We mentioned our disappointment to our server, who got the manager, Amanda.   She was very nice. We told her we were not satisfied and she had three new dishes prepared.  One of us changed her dish, but me and my other friend asked for the same dish, but wanted no batter on our shrimp and we would like newly cooked pasta.  After 15 more minutes passed our three dishes came out.  The pasta was once again cold and all clumped together and my shrimp were raw in the middle so I left the raw shrimp on the table.  We told the server, but the manager never came back.  We ordered coffee and I ordered a dessert.  When we got the check, I was very surprised not to see any adjustment for our far less than optimum meals.  I would have though the least they could have done was offer to comp is coffee and the dessert, but no way.  Our bill for three lunch entrees, soda, iced tea, coffee and one dessert was $92+ and no one finished the second meal.  Bad food, bad service.  None of us will go to the Cheesecake Factory again.

I&#39;m giving this Cheesecake Factory five stars. The fish tacos and lettuce chicken wraps were delicious. The pumpkin cheesecake, excellent. And last but not least, our server, Al, was very friendly and attentive.

Wow thanks for giving everyone else who had a birthday cheesecake but you give my nephew whipped cream? The service is the worst- the waiters/waitresses and even the male bartender we&#39;re so busy on a Wednesday night they left my table waiting for bread. After waiting about 20 mins I asked where our starter bread was and the Manager apologized and finally brought it out. I ordered steak medium rare and my mother in law medium and when they brought both steaks out they didn&#39;t specify which was which. Go to a different cheesecake or a different restaurant. This location is a JOKE.

There was a wait on a Sunday afternoon but it was so worth it. The decor is nice, sky high ceilings, ample seating-although they do pack you in close to other diners. My husband had chicken enchiladas and said that they were very good. I had a simple burger with cheddar and sautéed onions, and a small garden salad with vinagarette (instead of fries). It was all delicious and we were stuffed so got cheesecake to go to eat later. Our server was super friendly and efficient. We can&#39;t wait to go back again! Lost a star only because of the seating so close to other diners.

We loved it!! Awesome food, waiter was great, place is very clean and colorful. I recommend the farfalle garlic chicken pasta. It was delicious!! Brought 3 pieces of cheesecake back to our hotel and it took us 2 days to eat it. Will definitely be back
Love their chicken marsala it&#39;s the best dish I always get it tasted really good this time for some reason definitely will come back again good server and it came out pretty quick
Great restaurant. Only thing is the wait is pretty long depending on what time you go. I&#39;ve waited as long as 1 hour and 30 minutes, almost 2 hours.

Get the fried zucchini and thank me later!!! I absolutely love the small plate menu!! Cuban rolls are to die for!!! Excellent service, very clean restaurant!! I personally love the carrot cake even though I know it&#39;s a cheesecake place!! The chicken madera is amazing! Don&#39;t know how s chain restaurant can make such perfect mashed potatoes but they do.

So I am someone who likes to eat at the Cheesecake Factory, but not today!!!  Went around 4:00 hoping to avoid crowds. It was nice a quiet. I ordered my meal and waited a half hour to receive a Luke warm plate.  When I finally could flag down staff (my waiter was MIA throughout) everyone was apologetic and assured me I would get a nice hot meal. So I waited another 20 minutes to receive my same meal back burned and nuked and again only just warm. What the heck and my missing waiter tries to argue with me. I had purposely mixed some rice with the first meal so I could tell if they were going to hand back my same meal and they did. <br><br>I just walked out after my waiter chose to agrue me with.  Really bad service, food, and customer service. <br><br>Peabody Cheesecake Factory epic fail!!

The Cheesecake Factory is a restaurant that everyone can find something to eat. The menu is over twenty pages with foods from different cuisines. The lines are typically very long because everyone enjoys this place. They do not take reservations that I&#39;m aware of. I normally get the Chicken Romano. I like this dish a lot, it is always very consistent. The servers always tell me that the food is made from scratch. So you can change the dish to your liking. The reason I gave it four stars is because this place is called the Cheesecake Factory yet they were out of several different cheesecakes tonight. Otherwise, this place is very good.

Tonight was my first time here. The food was delicious; I had the Mac&#39;n Cheese Burger with sweet potato fries thennnn Red Velvet cheesecake. All of my party ordered burgers and they were tasty. I downgraded the star because 2 of our 8 meals come to the table incorrectly and they were &#34;out of strawberries&#34; to make strawberry shortcake. :( it&#39;s Saturday night, where are the berries. Our server did a good job overall taking care of our larger party and several other tables.

The Cheesecake Factory has always been a top favorite for me. They have a large menu selection, and great drinks. I have been to this location probably over 10 times, but I&#39;m going to review the most recent visit.<br><br>The restaurant and mall was absolutely packed, as I believe it was the first Saturday where everyone and their mother wanted to prepare for Christmas shopping. The entire front was filled with about 50 people, and 15-20 strollers. I walked in and asked how long the wait would be for 2 and she said there was no wait which was awesome. Of course we sat in a crowded area with one bench and one uncomfortable chair but beggars can&#39;t be choosers. So our server came over to us almost immediately. We ordered waters while we waited to decide but didn&#39;t want to spend the extra cash. The waitress forgot to bring the bread, which I reminded her. No harm, no foul but the bread is so key!!! We got Fried Mac n Cheese for an appetizer which was pretty good. I&#39;d give them a 3 out of 5. I love mac and cheese, mac and cheese bites, anything to do with mac and cheese. I believe the ricotta was what threw off the taste a little. And I would have preferred 6 smaller ones than 4 larger ones but that&#39;s just me being a pain. Not the best but I&#39;m a sucker for mac and cheese so. For my meal I ordered the Chicken Avocado Club because I couldn&#39;t commit to all of the flavors all the other dishes offer, while my mom ordered the Louisiana Chicken Pasta. It took about 10-15 minutes to get which was great because we were starving. My mom said her pasta was spicy but delicious, she really enjoyed it. My sandwich was very good but hard to eat because of how tall it was. Then I had the Chocolate Godiva Cheesecake with Glazed Strawberries for dessert, while my mom ordered the Raspberry Lemon Cake Cheesecake? I always get the same dessert because I don&#39;t want to commit to and $8 slice of something I may not like. The Raspberry Lemon Cake Cheesecake was really good. I like how the bottom half isa  cake and the top half is cheesecake. The whipped cream at TCF is too heavy for such rich cheesecakes. We ordered 1 appetizer to split, 2 meals, and 2 slices of cheesecake and it was still almost $70. I thought skipping on the alcohol would make it less expensive. Nope! <br><br>In a past visit, I have wanted one of their signature drinks that they took off the menu and they were able to make it for me. I really appreciate that. Also found out they serve omelettes/breakfast all day. May be worth a try sometime. <br><br>TCF has good food, great dessert, great drinks, nice ambiance/ decor, friendly busy servers, and is definitely a spot you go for a casual hangout, or get together.

I&#39;ve been here multiple times and the food is always really delicious. I&#39;ve gotten multiple dishes and always have been extremely satisfied. My boyfriend and I went the other day and we realized just how much this restaurant had to offer with their broad and diverse menu. We decided we are gonna be more of regulars!

Best chain restaurant. I love the four cheese pasta, it&#39;s always so good. The low calorie flatbread pizza is good. Tried the garlic shrimp pasta (subbed penne for angel hair) and it was so good. Cheesecakes are always amazing including their low carb cheesecake if you&#39;re looking for a lighter one.

Came to the cheesecake last minute on a random weekday night and had the pleasure of having Amanda G as my server! My husband and I have many food allergies and have many (annoying) requests lol. She was amazing! She accommodated to our every needs with that beautiful smile on her face and was just so lovely! Thank you Amanda!!
the restaurant was awesome I love the waiters the food was good and nice [especially Kevin​]<br><br>show this to Kevin, ​please. <br>the​ best

The service was good. The food was beyond disappointing. I got the Skinnylicious Tuscan Chicken To Go....  there are 3 dried out chicken breasts that my plastic knife can&#39;t cut through, 1 measly artichoke, a few tomatoes, and asparagus spears that look like a 4 year old cut them with a dull blade. I&#39;m also being generous by saying there&#39;s 1 tablespoon of farro. Super disappointed.

My family LOVES The Cheesecake Factory, just NOT this location. This is the 2nd time we&#39;ve given this location a try and we were disappointed both times. Today was definitely the LAST time I&#39;ll be back to the location.<br>The waitress was really nice so we tipped her well but the food was horrible. We got the nachos with chicken as an appetizer which is our fave app, they burnt it for the 2nd time. The chicken was literally so hard that we didn&#39;t even eat the chicken because we couldn&#39;t chew it. My husband loved his Cuban sand which but both ends of it were burnt. My daughter ate NONE of her meal the grilled chicken was burned and hard just like the nacho chicken, mashed potatoes looked like it had more skin then potatoes and the broccoli needed to be steamed longer. I got the lunch sized chicken Caesar salad and I didn&#39;t even at half of it. I was better off getting a salad from Nicks Bistro for $10, seriously. The first time we went just my husband and I spend $73 tipped well and the food was gross we complained about the service and food on the survey and thy sent us a $25 gift card to come back and give them another try. Seriously? So that&#39;s what we did this evening. We spend over $100 tonight my husband said he should&#39;ve just put a $100 bill in the toilet and flushed it and saved his gas. If that helps you at all. Oh and by the way ALL the utensils were GROSS.

Had an amazing night tonight and it&#39;s been a very long time since I&#39;ve gone to a restaurant and 1 enjoyed the food and 2 enjoyed the service as well TALIA M. was absolutely amazing me and my fiancé were having trouble on deciding what we wanted to eat my fiancé was torn between carbonara and the filet mignon so she suggested the carbonara needless to say it was amazing and me with my many menu questions she answered them all perfectly, it was my fiancé birthday dinner so she got everyone together and had them sing for him even though he wanted his to go cause he was so full from eating everything again her personality was amazing, friendly, and personal made us feel like we knew her for a while and always making sure We were okay and had everything We needed through out our meal when We go back Well  be making sure she&#39;s working that day or just wait for a time she is working thank you again for making this night so awesome

Hard to find a negative thing to say about the cheesecake, it&#39;s always been on my list favorite restaurants. Love their consistency when it comes to the service and quality of food. <br><br>This particular one in Peabody was no exception. Well located, usual great ambiance that you  expect from a CF. Only complaint during this evening was that they had no wasabi ahi tuna, (maybe the best item on the menu) no big deal really, except for the fact that I was not made aware till about 15-20 minutes after placing my order, stomach was growling... when the manager came over to apologize I asked if he would throw in a free drink and he responded with a NO with a somewhat sarcastic laugh. He said he couldn&#39;t do that... you are a manager, you made a mistake, don&#39;t tell me u can&#39;t throw in a drink, of course u can!! <br><br>Anyhow, four stars it is, not a flawless experience but a very good experience nonetheless. Food was fantastic.

Excellent service, Joana was our waitress and a very sweet lady. The food is delicious and the deserts really to die for. I used to love the seafood casserole, hopefully they&#39;ll have it back in their menu soon!

Place is trash. 16 booths open and they sit me at a table next to some squids when the entire row of tables were still open. I said I&#39;d rather a booth because I was with my kids and they let me know I&#39;d have to wait another 15 minutes.  Again, there were booths open all over the restaurant. Someone needs to train the host to get her act together. Poor attitude and customer service. If I&#39;m beating fair, the brunch wasn&#39;t bad at all, just the service was horrendous. Do yourself a favor and go to the Bancroft next store.

Fruit flies were buzzing around us the whole time we ate and that just grosses me out.  That being said, the proportions are huge so if you&#39;re really hungry this could be a good stop.  I won&#39;t return because of the gnats.  Staff was the best part of the experience.  We were seated quickly even though a ton of people were waiting so that was nice too.

So, I originally gave this place more stars than I should have with all the mistakes my orders have received but I was lenient because I love the food. <br><br>Anyways, last night I came here with 3 other people and our server was great. Listened to our orders, got everything right and was very helpful. Him and my amazing fried macaroni and cheese balls earned the two stars! I think his name was Mike if I remember right.<br><br>Anyways, my sister and I ordered the smokehouse burgers and my wife and sister in law ordered the ribeye steaks for $27. Their plates were small and definitely far from worth the price but at least their steaks were cooked right so they were fine. My sister and I both ordered our burgers well done. We bite into them and they&#39;re still bleeding. My sister didn&#39;t want to be a pain so she just ate hers but I had to send mine back because the thought of eating bleeding meat made my stomach turn. The server was nice about it and sent it back. Took about 15 min to get a new one and by the time I got it back I was full from picking at my fries so I just got it wrapped to go. I live all the way in Southbridge and Boston traffic was ridiculous so we didn&#39;t get home until about 1 am. I was hungry so I decided to heat up my burger. I bite it...looked fine...took a second bite and there was all pink meat in the middle. I was very upset. Not only my toppings weren&#39;t packed in the box or even my bbq sauce but my meat was not cooked thoroughly AGAIN. We had a $130 bill plus tip and I can&#39;t even get my burger cooked right after the second time. <br><br>This is very frustrating since this happens EVERY time I go here. I never eat dinner with my family I get to sit there and watch them and then they feel bad for eating while I&#39;m waiting and it definitely ruins the mood. <br><br>Safe to say I won&#39;t be returning to this location. I may give the one in Boston another chance since I really do enjoy the food and especially the cheesecake. Sad.

Great Service and good came hot ! Great great communication. The wait was not long and we were served within 15 minutes from entering the restaurant. The brunch menu is detailed and has many different items that are great for all ages.

I had one of the best meals of the summer here tonight.  My wife had the hibachi steak and I had the Sheila&#39;s Chicken and Avocado salad.  The Long Island ice teas were strong and delicious.  <br><br>Excellent service, excellent food and dessert.  An all-around perfect night out.
Went there for dinner are waiter was very good fast and very friendly I order the stuff mushrooms awesome but I order chicken parmesan and it had no taste what so ever

We sat at the bar. Excellent service. We ordered off the &#34;light&#34; lunch menu. I had the lettuce wraps. Sooo good. The rest of us had a chopped salad, huge and delicious, and another order of chicken lettuce wraps. <br>Two pieces of cheesecake to go and we were off to continue shopping

WHAT HAPPENED!!! Cheesecake, you were so consistently predictable. I enjoyed your food because I knew what to expect and I got it. Food -YUM! Waitstaff-Great! <br><br>Now, not so much (saying this with thick disappointment in my voice while slowly shaking my head side to side).<br>Cheesecake Factory, you were my go-to restaurant for everything and anything. Birthdays. Anniversaries. Graduations. Valentine&#39;s Day. Mothers&#39;s Day. Tuesday...<br><br>Over the last year I started to notice a greasy sheen developing on, well, every surface. I tolerated it. The food was still exceptionally consistent. <br><br>Next point. <br><br>When my husband and I started going to Cheesecake years ago we had a waiter named Chris. We always asked for him. Chris was attentive, funny, real. He never forgot my extra sauces on the side. He was just the right amount of chat and personality. If Chris wasn&#39;t working, no problem, all the servers were great!<br><br>Now when we go, we get &#34;Lauren&#34; (made up name). Lauren has all the conversational skills of a potato. Lauren has a deadpan voice with monotone inflections. Lauren is one of three or four waitstaff that end up bringing food and such to our table. They might as well all be &#34;Lauren&#34;.<br><br>Two more points of consternation:<br><br>1) The last two times I went to Cheesescake, while I was leafing through the (now slimy with residue) menu, I came across food smoothed between the pages. <br>Both times. <br><br>2) This last point should be the first point and highlighted at that! <br>The last two times I/we went to Cheesecake Factory the food was NOT CONSISTANT!!! The first time the Alfredo sauce in the Fettuccine was split and sour. My Shrimp Scampi was delicious, but my daughter was out a meal. My husbands burger was extra well done when he ordered it medium rare. <br>The last visit was the clincher. <br>Split sauce (my daughter always orders the Fettuccine Alfredo (picky eater)), Burger over cooked, skimpy sauce on the Mac and Cheese Balls aaaaand my Pasta Carbonara was dry. Dry, dry, dry. Top that off with food in my slimy menu and &#34;Lauren&#34; as our waitress and Cheesecake Factory made its debut on my &#34;Blacklist&#34;. <br><br>Side note (I&#39;m not a jerk. I waited tables for years!!!)<br>I/we tip 20% to the penny if the food and/or service stinks. <br><br>I will truly miss you, Cheesecake Factory I used to know... <br>(Head in hand. Tear rolling down cheek. Curtain closes.)

It is the Cheesecake factory, so why bother with a review huh? <br><br>It is the best franchise restaurant for sure.  Try the cajun pasta...<br><br>The service at this one is much better than previous visits in other locations.  This place is great.

Let me tell you about my FIRST and ONLY visit to the cheese cake factory, or as I now call it, ass cake factory. The wait for 4 people was about 1 hour and 15 minutes, which is okay because it was a Friday night. When we got to our seats, our waitress took our orders and there was no problem. BUT, the problem occurred when the food took more than a hour and a half to get our food, which we never got because the manager said it was delivered to the wrong table. WOW how could a well known restaurant mess up so bad on my first and only visit. Really disappointed in this place, but my party ended up going to Polcari&#39;s<br> in Saugus. If there&#39;s anything I want you fellow yelpers to take from this, go to Polcari&#39;s first.

It&#39;s a known fact that the Cheesecake Factory is the place to go when you can&#39;t decide where to eat. The servings are huge and the cheesecake is cheesecake. As far as food goes I&#39;d say it&#39;s always a safe move to try the fried mac &amp; cheese balls. Those are pretty good and the nachos are good too but it&#39;s a HUGE portion!!! Meal wise I&#39;d say to try the Parmesan Herb Crusted Chicken. It&#39;s a good size and pretty good as well as a safe choice if you don&#39;t know what to get.

I have been to some I loved.   But lately this one...for starters the service has seemed pretty impersonal where it used to be fun and friendly.    I love Caesar salad, even if they don&#39;t have anchovies, but the dressing only tasted of garlic and a lot of it.   I didn&#39;t finish, and neither did the server seek to notice that most was left.   Chicken was moist enough. And the pasta was ok, but nothing to write home about.   They need to up the ante again.   The only thing I really enjoy here is the brown bread....unless of course you want cheese cake lol!

The food is pretty standard at any Cheesecake Factory, so I can&#39;t complain there. I go in knowing what to expect with what I am eating and haven&#39;t been disappointed.<br><br>I was, however, very disappointed with the service. In a couple words: severely lacking. We were seated and waited for our server. And waited. And waited. After about 15 minutes, she finally comes over and gets our drink order and hands us menus. My husband asked for strawberry lemonade. I asked for water. Pretty simple, I think. The table(s) next to us had a group of about 10 people and all ordered cocktails....after we place our water and lemonade order. It&#39;s not that I care about what they are drinking. It&#39;s the fact that all their cocktails take time to prepare and mix (especially when there are several of them) as opposed to our very quick drink order, one of which is WATER. So how is it that they get their drinks several minutes before we do? I mean it&#39;s the same server.<br> <br>We actually did get to order food before they did, which was surprising given how the server was bending over backwards for them and seemingly ignoring us. While waiting, baskets of bread kept being given to them. We had to ask for ours...more than once. Not surprisingly, their food came out first, getting it in about 10-15 minutes while we waited almost double that. How does a group of at least 10 people get all their food before a table of two when we ordered first? I&#39;ll tell you how: they kept reordering cocktail which is $$$$ for the restaurant. And when they are spending that money, I guess the server doesn&#39;t care much about the table right next to them that she is also serving. <br><br>Extremely disappointing. For a chain, I rather like Cheesecake Factory. But this location seriously needs to work on their service. As for alcoholic drinks, we happily went elsewhere after dinner and enjoyed several where the service was infinitely better.

Ummm...yeah. I&#39;m all done with this place. Last two visits were a disaster.  Both times either the pager didn&#39;t work (&#34;oh, that just happens sometimes, sorry&#34;) or another silly story as to why they filled seats ahead of you that did not make sense - simply put - poor, inattentive staffing at the desk. <br>They are always busy, they really don&#39;t care if they lose a customer - there are plenty others to pick from. It&#39;s too bad, I liked this place, but it&#39;s just a big chain now and not worth the hassle for me.

Its like any other Cheesecake Factory... Drinks are over priced, meals are over priced but the food is OOHHH SOOO GOOODDD!!!!   This was our Diet cheat night birthday dinner!!! <br><br>We ate too much, drank too much, but had a damn good time doing it... We were seated at the bar area which I hate but then after all it was a decent time... I understand the more tables you cram in the place the more people you can seat... but I hate that we sit soo close to other tables...<br><br>This night was decent, the waitress could have been more attentive, but it was good... <br><br>We will go again, and then just complain after that we ate too much &amp; spent entirely way too much!

Cheesecake Factory is one of those restaurants that can be great for a group of people all with different likes when it comes to food. With a menu of more than 18 pages,  each member of your party is sure to find something they like. Salads are very good and plentiful and they have very good pasta dishes. A personal favorite of mine is the Chicken Romano which is thin chicken breasts pounded and prepared with Romano cheese crust served with pasta with a tomato cream sauce.

Come here all the time. This is one of the best chain restaurants! Food can take a long time sometimes. Banana cream pie is <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbomb.com&amp;s=bb4f996415a9c2f21137e27cfb68f439a48cec2652b53e9b50dd7e766dbe177e" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">bomb.com</a>

Great atmosphere and wonderful service.  Just had the chick potstickers and they are simply scrumptious.  Our waitress is very pleasant and now I can&#39;t wait for more.  I&#39;m getting one of their signature burgers.  Great place all around, recommend this place to anyone who is either in town or not from around this area.

If I could give zero stars I would, my partner and I were just in this location for lunch, we sat for 10 minutes before anyone asked us our drink order, as we were waiting the two tables beside of us were seated they both got their drinks Before we did, we waited patiently because we are both in the service industry, 25 minutes went by we still never got our drinks or the appetizer we ordered, we decided to leave, told the hostess what happend and she just looked at us like we had 5 heads, my partner decided to call and speak to the manager who said sorry, it wasn&#39;t me, and that was it. What a terrible experience. I will make sure I tell everyone I know and share on all social media about the terrible service you get at this location

Waited for an hour for our food! Gave up and left. Absolutely did not expect such a poor level of service especially from such a well- known restaurant. The appetiser; lettuce wraps an absolute no brainer took very long to arrive and the entrees never even reached our table. The only thing that came in time was the IcedTea!

Always a great place to go when you can&#39;t decide where to head for lunch or dinner.  As you must know, the menu is extensive and I&#39;m pretty sure there&#39;s even a table of contents.  Cheesecake is expensive per slice but is a novelty.  Two people could easily split one.  I gave this review four stars since it can be noisy, wait is long, and all the tables are on top of each other.  <br><br>You have to be smart when ordering if you don&#39;t want to spend a lot since some of the choices are pricey or overpriced.  For instance, some pasta dishes are pricey where you have to think----pasta is $1 a box in the store.  LOL. Portions are large however. There was an issue once at our table with food being incorrect, but the manager came over and was super nice and took it off the bill.    Never a bad experience.
The food was okay. Definitely overpriced. The presentation of the food was overkill. Tasty egg roll sampler and macaroni and cheese.
Probably the slowest serviced &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34; I&#39;ve ever been to. And they keep getting our orders wrong. But they were apologetic which made it up.

So as someone who has worked in restaurants most of my working life, I actually really appreciate what this chain does.<br><br>The skinilicious menu has some very tasty options with good portions considering the caloric content. It&#39;s great of them to be looking out for health conscious people.<br><br>I had the spicy Jamaican peppered shrimp with brown rice - excellent, excellent. Perfectly spicy, perfectly cooked rice, and of course a large enough portion to take some home (and I have a very healthy appetite)<br><br>Also, LOVE their sugar-free cheesecake. One of the only places I know of offering a real and tasty carb-conscious dessert.<br><br>My biggest issue is that every time I go in, I end up seated at a banquette in the bar area about 6 inches from another occupied table when there is no one else at this 12 seat banquette. I understand it is someone&#39;s section, but when it is dead like that, maybe putting a table between my party and the other one would be wise. This is happened three out of four times I&#39;ve been there in the last couple of months. Very awkward.

I didn&#39;t have a good experience. Waiter was rude and unprofessional. I enjoyed the appetizer. Took 2 bites of the food and was gagging. I was disappointed in taking over 20 minutes to seat and over 30+ minutes for the food to get out there.

I drive 2 hours and cross 2 state lines to get here because the cheesecake is amazing. They&#39;re a little pricey but the food is really good which makes the drive and check worth it. They have quite an extensive menu so there is something just about anybody. Located in the mall is great so you can do some shopping before eating. The service was pretty great considering we were a group of 9 young adults 6 of which were crazy guys. My sister is a picky eater and didn&#39;t care for her meal and they didn&#39;t have a problem exchanging it for her. Overall great experience will definitely be back.

I do not believe in chain restaurants, but I believe in The Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>This is a very specific review. I cannot speak of the dessert or of the dining atmosphere. I always go alone for lunch- straight to the small bar. I get the seared tuna tataki salad. Every time, the service is wonderful, and the food is reliably delicious.<br><br>Their coffee is good and strong- a rarity in these types of eateries.<br><br>Thank you Cheesecake Factory. Five thumbs up.
food always great here...every visit but one was ok....can never forget about a blond hair in my food,  a coupled months  back, but we gave THEm a revisit...if itwasnt for that, it be 4 stars atleast

My daughter&#39;s birthday is on Easter this year and she requested to go to the Cheesecake Factory. The closest one is an hour away. I decided to call and make sure they&#39;re open on Easter Sunday. <br>Our conversation follows:<br><br>Me: Are you open on Easter?<br><br>Cheesecake Factory: Yep<br><br>Me: Are you open during your regular hours?<br><br>Them: Yep<br><br>Me: Okay, thank you!<br><br>Them: (silence and click)<br><br>Hmm...I think we&#39;ll find another restaurant to celebrate her birthday.

Ordered take out.  Just wanted a dinner sized portion of Mac and cheese.  They said the only way they could do this was to order 2 sides of Mac and cheese and put it in one bowl which was fine, about 14.00.  Thats on par with Smokey Bones which has dinner plates of Mac and cheese.  They tell me 15 to 20 minutes for my food.  I get down to the restaurant in that time frame.  Food isn&#39;t ready.  I wait maybe another 5 to 8 minutes and they bring the food out.  I pay and rush back to work.  My food was barely room temperature. (I was only walking back to Macy&#39;s). The best part of the meal was the brown bread and butter.

Had lunch here today and was not impressed at all with our entrees.  The avocado egg roll app  was excellent, so tasty.  The two pasts dishes were a huge disappointment.  First, we ordered off the dinner portion and the quantity was rather small. I got the garlic noodles with shrimp and it was flavorless and real cheap on the mushrooms and other items. For 19.99 I expected so much more.

The spaghetti and meatballs were very good. The spaghetti was to die for! The meatballs were sweet. I always go with my family even though I have to wait a few minutes. (written by Stella H., 7 years old)

The food is always good here. Wait times can get longer during busy hours but staff works quickly, and provides accurate wait times. Food is always fresh, kid friendly, and they have a few craft beer selections. Will return.

Food is absolutely delicious and the menu is great BUT when you order pick-up the girls always keep you on hold for so long. A couple times they hung up on me. While I thought this was a one time thing, my friend told me the exact same thing happened to her. Then I ordered again the other day and I kept getting passed on to different people.. just very strange. So if you want food from here, don&#39;t get take out.

My daughter had an inexplicable bloody nose tonight. The staff couldn&#39;t have been more helpful, providing towels, napkins, ice etc.!<br><br>PS the regular table service and food was very good as usual.

I just got home from a shocking experience at this restaurant and felt I had to get this out there.<br><br>Wait time: 60 minutes, probably pretty standard for 7:15 on a Saturday, but the host was entirely too rude about it when I said I didn&#39;t hear the time. Luckily we ended up snagging a high top in the bar area.<br>Atmosphere: the music was WAY too loud, especially considering the number of people in the restaurant. I couldn&#39;t hear my friend sitting right next to me. The server was pushy to get food in, until she &#34;got us&#34;. Not sure what that means, but yeah we&#39;d like a moment to talk, relax, and take a look at the menu. She ended up being alright though.<br>Drinks: we ordered the Mumm napa split and only got one of the bottles.<br>Food: avocado egg rolls were good, chicken piccata was a problem, the sauce was bland, the chicken was undercooked on one side, and I&#39;m pretty sure they didn&#39;t salt the pasta water, veggie burger was very loose and fell apart. <br>The biggest issue by far though: there were two small children SITTING AT THE BAR! For almost an hour and not one single employee said a word!! The bartender took orders, served them food and drinks, etc! They couldn&#39;t have been more than 8 years old! This is a busy restaurant! Dozens of servers, bartenders, hosts, busers. How did no one know that&#39;s ILLEGAL? Finally, on the way out I asked for the manager and he said he hadn&#39;t noticed. This blew me away. I never thought much of Cheesecake Factory, but this experience takes the cake (pun intended).

I come here all the time with my family and boyfriend. The food and drinks are always amazing. The staff is always professional, friendly, and attentive. This is also my mom&#39;s favorite restaurant, and I can definitely see why!

The only reason this review is receiving even two stars is because of that magnificent chocolate cookie dough cheesecake. <br><br>When we walked in, it was going to be a 25-30 minute wait-- not bad and we were willing to wait. Luckily I was able to snag two bar stools while my boyfriend headed to the restroom and then out to his truck for something in the lot. I sat there for some time-- possibly 10 minutes and the same male bartender walked by a multitude of times. Now, I work in a restaurant and I&#39;m the editor of a newspaper so I know all about busy. However, he didn&#39;t even acknowledge me, as we was serving the male on one side of me and the other male on the opposite side. When my boyfriend came over, I went to the host stand to  cancel our names for the table, which took a mere 60 seconds. As I was heading back, my boyfriend had a napkin and plate in front of him immediately. I got back and he was asked what he wanted to drink immediately. I was never asked, throughout the course of the meal, if I wanted a drink even though my boyfriend was asked multiple times if he wanted a refill. Not sure if the bartender just didn&#39;t like serving women or if there was something else wrong because all of the men at the bar were taken care of at great length while I was barely acknowledged. <br><br>THE FOOD was okay but pretty boring. My boyfriend had the bang bang chicken, which was good but not spectacular. I had the Large Sautéed Shrimp with Angel Hair. The sauce was boring and didn&#39;t have that kick of flavor or even a punch of garlic. Also, it didn&#39;t taste like they cooked with wine as advertised. It tasted like it was strictly diced tomatoes warmed up on pasta with a few large shrimp tossed on the outside of the plate. And I&#39;m pretty sure they did not season the water when they cooked the pasta. It was just an all-around flat dish. <br><br>I do NOT recommend this location. It looks great on the outside with a large menu (possibly too large?) but you certainly only get your wallet&#39;s worth at the take-out cheesecake stand by the door. Otherwise, go no further.

This is my favorite restaurant. Every time I go I have a fantastic experience. Service and food are both always great quality. I like to try some new on the menus every time and have never been disappointed. First of all I always get the fried mac and cheese balls because they are my favorite. As for the main course I have ordered the steak and cheese, spicy crispy chicken sandwich with chipotle sauce (my boyfriends favorite and he gets it every time), orange chicken (amazing), Parmesan crusted chicken (can&#39;t go wrong), montecristo sandwich (brunch menu on Sunday and it sure was yummy), bacon cheese burger, and my most recent the chicken Parmesan pizza style (this was amazing). Then the cheesecake oh boy it&#39;s top of the line. I highly recommend the lemon raspberry, Adams Peanut butter, red velvet or tuxedo. I absolutely love this place and have always been satisfied with each visit!

Cheesecake Factory has become a staple for the boo and I, we just love it. Wait is never ridiculous, and service is always on point.<br><br>I usually get the same thing and the other night noticed what I get wasn&#39;t on the menu anymore. Waitress &amp; Chef were amazing and still made it for me anyway, and that is what I call SERVICE !<br><br>BBQ Salmon is to die for, perfectly cooked salmon, mashed potatoes, yummy corn medley, and topped off with the best onion rings !<br><br>I&#39;ve also come and just got a bunch of apps, as well as brunch. You truly cannot go wrong with coming here. Friendly staff, and huge portions of food.

Cheesecake Factory has always been a favorite for our family, no matter where we travel in NE.  If there&#39;s a Cheesecake in the vicinity of where we are visiting, you&#39;ll find us dining for lunch or dinner &#39;at least&#39; once.<br><br>Tonight when we took a consensus of where everyone wanted to go, the answer &#34;Cheesecake&#34;!  So off we go, with the anticipation of great food and great service!!<br><br>Thank you Cheesecake for providing such great quality restaurants for our dining enjoyment, and which offer a family friendly environment!!  =)

Outstanding!!! Our server, Tim was great. He was friendly, funny, and full of life. Food was delicious and the name cheesecake does not disappoint. The coffee cheesecake was to die for. Cannot wait to return.

Wonderful gluten free and veggie options. We had a table of three people with food sensitivities and gluten intolerance. The waiter, Malcom L, was excellent and accommodated our complicated orders easily. I got the Kobe beef burger which was not good, but all of the other food was delicious.

5 stars for the Cheesecake 2 stars for the food. The menu is seriously ridiculous here. There must be over 50 items on it ranging from American to Asian, Mexican, Italian, and so on. It definitely needs some slimming down! I&#39;ve never been overly impressed by anything that I&#39;ve ordered. The cheesecake however...heaven on a plate! So many delicious cheesecakes to choose from! Skip the food...get a seat at the bar, have some drinks, grab some cheesecake and enjoy!

The best food I have ever had has been from the cheesecake factory. There mac and cheese balls are the best thing I have ever eaten in my whole life. It is great for a casual meal with friends, or even a date. It is a little pricey, but you pay for what you get. and youre getting th best food and experience that any food establishment has to offer!

Went last night with my wife. Was very disappointed with the meal and a little dissatisfied with the service. I ordered the New York style steak, medium. What I received was a quarter inch thick medium well done piece of beef that had no flavor whatsoever. I really do think the cook forgot to season it. I was going to send it back but the waitress took 20 minutes to check on us. I didn&#39;t have time waiting for them to fix it for me so I sucked it up and ate half of it. My wife had the chicken Marsala, she thought it was ok but a little below what she would expect. I&#39;ve come to the conclusion that unless you order &#34;the comfort food&#34; items, the food is nothing special.  Probably won&#39;t go back.

I love The Cheesecake Factory. I don&#39;t care if I&#39;m consuming three days worth of calories in one sitting, the food is simply too delicious to resist.<br><br>I came here with my roommate because we had received a $10 off coupon, and we figured that we should take advantage of it. I ordered the Chicken and Shrimp Gumbo, and it was amazeballs, naturally. The gumbo has such a nice kick to it, giving the dish that extra something. Our waitress was incredibly pleasant and accommodating. Despite the restaurant being crazy busy (like it usually is) we were seated within 15 minutes and were out of there within an hour and 15.<br><br>Overall, a wonderful experience and I would definitely return!
Always a great experience. We enjoy bringing the kids here for lunch. Food is always good.  Wait Staff is friendly and knowledgeable about menu. Love the decor and the deserts are fabulous!

Food was good. Service was horrible. Order nachos and a beer. Nachos beat the beer out which should absolutely never happen. Was checked on once in an hour and then it took 15 minutes to run my card to checkout. Server went and took orders of food and drink from 2 other tables. Nothing like what this place should be run like for the prices and atmosphere.

I honestly can say that I don&#39;t go here as often because the restaurant just isn&#39;t what it used to be.<br><br>1- the food hasn&#39;t been as good lately. It hasn&#39;t been completely hot out of the kitchen or as flavorful lately. We ordered the Chicken Quesadilla and 2 pieces were almost empty and there was barely any chicken. When I got my pasta, it seemed like it had been sitting for a while, as the top was barely warm. <br><br>2- service has been severely lacking. Tonight, we started with one server who was great and on her game. Then she transferred the table to another server. That wasn&#39;t the issue, I understand she wanted to get out of there ( although she was still there when we left? ) The server that took over was nice, but obviously unable to handle the extra table. I&#39;m sure her section was no where near our table, as we were sitting for a while in between visits. Our food was taking a while, which she noticed, but it was still a little too long. After we got our food, she didn&#39;t come back until my boyfriend was done. I hadn&#39;t even gotten to eat most of my food because I needed to drink something (because of a throat condition) and didn&#39;t have anything to drink. Then when she took my plate, instead of asking if we wanted coffee or dessert ( which I did) she just walked away and came back 10 minutes later with menus. At this point, I was sick of waiting and decided to forget about the cheesecake. I understand she has other tables and such, but it&#39;s not fun to sit there waiting while everyone else just walks by and looks at your table. Multiple servers saw our empty drink glasses at the edge of the table and no one offered to help. Yeah, it&#39;s not their table, but it&#39;s a good practice. <br><br>I really hope that Cheesecake Factory can turn it around. It was one of my favorites, but lately, I&#39;ve been wishing we went somewhere else.

It was fine, service was OK, however I was really craving and in need of a cappuccino, not a latte...  And I got it also to go. What I really got was 12 ounces of milk and a shot of expresso. If you plan on making cappuccinos and lattes you should know the difference. Also asked for cinnamon and the woman never heard of it apparently ? Also advice, maybe offer soy or almond milk.

This location is very lucky that CF has a good reputation... Food is always below standard (we have eaten in locations in multiple states), and service is horrible. We ate there today, and our server couldn&#39;t be bothered. My daughter&#39;s Bow Tie Alfredo sat in the window so long that it had separated and needed to be sent back to be retossed with sauce. Wasn&#39;t offered an iced tea refill, though we had an appetizer, lunch, and cheesecake... Our meal time took almost 2 hours, due to poor service - we continually ask ourselves why we go back...

I have to say, that my usual experience with this location is about an 8 out of 10.<br>It&#39;s a chain restaurant. Shouldn&#39;t expect anything else.<br><br>This last visit was a 2 to 3.<br><br>Ordered my son past. With butter only. No garish, just plain. Simple enough. <br>It&#39;s not a dietary restriction, just it&#39;s what he enjoys the most. <br><br>All our tables dinners come out and his is covered in parsley.<br>His is taken back to be re-done.<br>Our plates sit there getting cold. <br>Second plate comes out, and now it&#39;s in Alfredo Sauce.<br>Back it goes again.<br><br>All the other food at this point is cold. (20 minutes after presenting the first plates)<br>Not even enjoyable to say the least.<br><br>Manager offers us a free dessert. <br>Would have rather had my meal reheated than a free dessert.<br>Manager and wait staff, not even concerned, that we are waiting to eat.<br>Due to the fact that my son doesn&#39;t have any food in front of him.<br><br>Just a lack of communication and common sense.<br>I know it&#39;s a chain, but if this is the new standard of what I should expect, there are other choices in the area.

The Cheesecake Factory (TCF) is a pretty solid dining option offering a very extensive menu which reads like a storybook with several pages. It can take a while to decide on what to eat since there are so many choices. They also offer small (skinny) plates for those with smaller appetites and watching calories. Lunch specials are offered until 5PM, brunch is offered on Sundays and they also have specials in the bar area (Mondays-Fridays 4PM-6PM) offering selected full size appetizers for only $5.00.<br><br>I&#39;ve been to several TCF locations throughout the US and have had very good meals each time, but there was usually quite a wait to be seated. I found some TCF gift cards (a few years old)  which I needed to use up. My friend and I decided to make a special trip from NH to The Cheesecake Factory at the Northshore Mall for an early dinner and arrived here around 3:55PM on a Monday. We were seated immediately at a table in the bar area. Our server Todd arrived promptly and went over the specials and also informed us about the &#34;bar menu&#34; with several $5 appetizers listed.<br><br>For appetizers ($5 each/normally $9.95 each), we ordered the Fried Calamari and the Fire Roasted Fresh Artichoke. The Fried Calamari (rings &amp; tentacles) were coated in a light and crisp tempura batter (not too greasy) and served with a creamy garlic dip and tangy cocktail sauce. The Artichokes (3) were messy to eat, but were very good and fresh and the artichoke hearts were very tender, served with a creamy garlic dip and vinaigrette dressing.<br><br>For dinner, the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta ($16.95-full sized portion) was very spicy which had tender shrimp, soft boneless chicken sauteed with tomato, onions, and peppers over soft linguini (regular and green noodles) and topped with fresh grated parmesan cheese (optional). My friend ordered the Vietnamese Shrimp Summer Rolls ($5/normally $9.95) three rice paper rolled with bean sprouts, carrots, asparagus, shittake mushrooms, green onion, cilantro, &amp; shrimp, served chiiled over crispy rice noodle &amp; red cabbage and spicy peanut dipping sauce.<br><br>The food was enjoyable and filling and we needed a box for the leftovers. Unfortunately, we did not save room for cheesecake and coffee, but probably next time. The service was very good, very attentive and informative. The food arrived in timely fashion, the ice waters were refilled and our server made recommendations from the menu. <br><br>We will be back!

Came in tonight looking for a good relaxing meal with my honey . The food was good the service was HORRIBLE our server was MIA most of our meal. I don&#39;t expect to have rose petals thrown at my feet or be hand fed but I do expect good service.  She barely checked on us, kept forgetting drinks, and left our plates even after we were clearly finished and finished for sometime. We spent most of our meal just waiting oh and I&#39;m waiting now still which is AWESOME. I am literally writing this review as I&#39;m wait <br>for it....WAITING!!!! FYI it&#39;s a Thursday night not busy at all. I won&#39;t be coming back for a while.

My friend and I had dinner here the other night. We had to wait, so we headed to the bar. The bartender was friendly and efficient, and we both enjoyed a drink before eating. My buddy had a beer, and I had a Tanqueray martini; his beer was seven dollars, my cocktail was fourteen- yes, a bit pricey, but very good. For an appetizer we got the Tex Mex eggrolls. They were crispy, and the filling was tasty. Just enough of a spicy kick. For entrees, my friend got a burger- I can&#39;t remember which one, and I ordered the Hibachi steak. My friend woofed his burger down in no time! He loved it. I really enjoyed my steak- it was tender and flavorful. My only complaint would be that the mashed potatoes that came with it were a little on the cool side. Other than that, I would definitely order the Hibachi steak again. Our server was personable, and on point. I would go back to try other tempting items on the menu.

My friend and I were wandering around the North Shore Mall and decided to go to The Cheesecake Factory for dinner. It was a beautiful night, so we requested outdoor seating.   There are two large patio areas that can accommodate parties of various sizes.  Our waiter was very attentive and promptly took our drink order.
