I tried the skinny cosmopolitan, which is a lighter version of a Cosmo but still had delicious taste and flavor- at only 150 calories. The dark and sourdough bread were both were both warm and the waiter brought more throughout our meal. The Chinese Chicken Salad was just as described on the menu- and a very large portion! Mounds of rice noodles and wontons covered the tons of romaine and chicken. The salad dressing was sweet and I has the dressing on the side so that I could use the amount that I wanted.<br><br>We had a delicious meal and will be heading back again soon.

I have been to this particular location multiple times and the experiences have been fine. Recently I went with a group of 9 to celebrate a friend&#39;s birthday during their Sunday brunch. The food took almost an hour to come out and when it did two of the orders were wrong. We started with one waitress that transferred our table to another waiter and never told us about the switch. When the staff noticed we were antsy for our meals, the manager came to our table saying &#34;they would do anything to make our experience enjoyable.&#34; Said in the most non-believable tone ever. Though the waiter that was transferred to our table was very friendly and nice, he did not check in once to see how our meals were and if we needed anything, which we did. <br><br>One girl ordered a breakfast sandwich eggs over hard another girl ordered a breakfast sandwich eggs over easy with no mayo and no ham. Both sandwiches, which we were told were the reason our meals took so long because they got messed up and had to be fixed, came out wrong in the end anyway. Both had ham and mayo with the eggs cooked at the wrong temperature. The waiter asked one girl &#34;if she had touched hers yet&#34; and &#34;if they just wanted to switch&#34;. Which wouldn&#39;t make a difference because one girl didn&#39;t want ham and mayo anyway. Side note, the birthday girl had to suffer through dry toast because our table was completely avoided after the incident. <br><br>The food was okay. Reading the menu we were excited for our meals but nobody was blown away by the quality. Should&#39;ve gone to a diner instead.

The food here is average and the service is also average. The menu is very large and offers something for everyone. If your looking for a quiet place to have lunch or dinner, this is not the place. The prices are a bit high and a bottle of Bud Light was 5.75, an outrageous price to charge. Overall, this place is 3 stars.
Went with wife and niece. Niece got spaghetti and meatballs but they were too salty the waitress kindly took it off the menu was very fast and my food was outstanding will be back again
Steak tacos, highly recommend, the guacamole is very good, plenty of flavor which is what I have found missing at Mexican restaurants, we keep getting the same waiter who is very good at his job.

This place is going down hill.  Particularly if you happen to eat at the bar.  While waiting 20 mins for my chicken piccata they were going to bring me some bread.  Which after about 10 min. they did.  Unfortunately they didn&#39;t give me a napkin or more importantly silverware to at least spread butter on the bread.  After literally another 10 min. of being ignored by the female bartender and still no piccata either I just got up and left.  Probably won&#39;t be back.

I went here for lunch today because had been here multiple times An had enjoyed my self you will always wait for a table 20 min wait they was out of macaroni an cheese bites my silver wear was dirty twice my waitress only seemed to be concerned with everything thing else but me when my food got to the table the pasta was raw An dry it tasted like my waitress was so everything but her job an not checking to see if my food was done so it sat under a heat lamp for 30 minutes on top of the the the management only took my food off the bill when I told them I was never coming back there could had care less this place is horrible do not eat there

First, a &#34;20 minute wait time&#34; turned into a 45 minute wait.<br>Second, the noise of kids banging silverware on the tables reached harassment levels.  No one from the restaurant would talk to these parents about their kids.<br>Third, despite the fact that we had 8 conversation about dietary restrictions, still they messed the dish up.<br>I would advise people with allergies or dietary restrictions to never eat at the Cheesecake Factory.  These people are ignorant and have no respect for people.  They serve low quality food for the masses at high end restaurant prices.

I have been to this Cheesecake Factory several times. The food isn&#39;t that great and the focus has shifted lately to quantity than quality. The ambiance is good, but lately on the weekends its so crowded like i feel that I&#39;m not at ease in my space. The service is going from okay to worse, my friend ordered a vegetarian dish and specifically told them to not put mushrooms, but they did anyways, and we told the server when our dishes were served, she said she can handpick them out. It was gross! I&#39;m not going back there.

My husband and I frequent the cheesecake factory often and we have never had a bad experience at this location! The staff is always extremely accommodating and professional. The food is always great and the menu has so many options we never leave displeased. My two favorites are the chicken avocado club and the luau salad. My mother has a food allergy which they also handle very well, we have met a manager named Charlie more than once who goes above and beyond. I know often times people like to avoid &#34;chains&#34; but this is a great option when going out to eat!

The Cheesecake Factory rarely disappoints; most of my experiences in dining there have been positive. I have been to a few different locations, and the one in Peabody did not stand out to me in any specific way from the rest, which I consider to be a good thing, since it is part of a chain. The design of the restaurant is intricate and warm, and the bathrooms are always glistening with cleanliness, which I highly value in an establishment. The service I received when I went there yesterday was lunch was great; our waitress was extremely friendly, professional, and polite, while also being laid-back enough to feel comfortable around as the youthful diners that my boyfriend and myself are. <br><br>I enjoyed going there during the day, not only for the lunch prices (lunch menu is available until 5:00!) but also because of the amount of natural light let into the restaurant. On other occasions, I have been there in the evening and the lamps and chandeliers give off a very dim yellow glow that can make it hard to see at times. It is a bit straining on the eyes, especially when reading the menu, but it is all a part of the unique atmosphere that the Factory creates.<br><br>Last time, I ordered the Fettucini with Chicken and Sun-Dried Tomatoes and cannot say that I will get it again, although I had ordered it last year and my memory of it was better than what I tasted when I tried it a second time. It is not to say it was unacceptably un-tasty; I was simply not a fan of the sauce this time-I blame it on my ever-changing taste buds! The pasta was cooked well, though the dish itself has both times been a bit too &#34;dry&#34; for me; better than swimming in sauce, I suppose.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory has an amazing menu; it is truly extensive in all areas: appetizers, sandwiches, pasta dishes, meat dishes, desserts, and drinks. (Blueberry mojitos are a favorite choice of mine). They also have a &#34;skinny menu&#34; for those of you who prefer or need to eat &#34;lighter&#34;. I definitely love the freshly grated cheese that is offered before every meal, and their Dynamite Shrimp appetizer is bomb! No pun intended ;)
Good food. So much on the menu to choose from. Too full from dinner to eat dessert so we took a mango keylime cheesecake to go. Can&#39;t wait to try it later tonight.

Went here for drinks tonight. Had strawberry daiquiris! Planned on getting cheesecake also but the drinks turned out to be enough.Our server jesse was wonderful! So nice and always asking if we needed anything! Such a great experience!

I just had dinner here on Monday January 22,18 with my boyfriend and our friend. They both had burgers my dinner was chicken Marsala with bow tie pasta which was yummy had the rest of it for my lunch with my boyfriend on Tuesday. They enjoyed their burgers cooked just right for them both. I go to Cheesecake Factory at least twice a year either here or in Boston. Tons of choices of things u can eat for lunch or dinner something for everyone even I believe a kids menu too. I will be returning again.

There&#39;s always a wait but it&#39;s worth it. The food and cheesecake are. always good and the waitress we had tonight was awesome! Cecelia made the night with her humor, helpfulness and great conversation. We&#39;ll definitely be back.
The spicy chicken sandwich is huge and amazing. I love the fries at the Cheesecake Factory and how they package them. Both items have great flavor. Best part is the spicy chipotle mayo.

This review concerns service only, specifically a dishonest charge. My son goes to school near this restaurant and frequents it on occasion. 4/8/16 he went there for dinner with friends and used a credit card to pay his bill. Today I got the credit card statement and the charge had been rounded up a couple bucks! I think that&#39;s dishonest and shameful! It&#39;s not a lot of money and likely not worth the hassle of disputing the charge with the credit card company, but I think we have all visited Cheesecake Factory for the last time, here in Peabody or the Braintree one we usually go to. Pay close attention to your bill!!

I ate here a couple years ago, ordered a pizza and it was excellent. The service was great and everything I had was very good. I over heard the customers at the next table over joking about always getting dessert, because no matter how full they were from the meal they always had room in their &#34;dessert stomach&#34; to order dessert. I took their advice, and had dessert and it was excellent.

I&#39;m not really a huge fan of this place. I really liked the atmosphere and it was really roomy and big. but the food quality wasn&#39;t the best, i was expecting a lot better because everybody talks about this place very highly. I was disappointed.<br><br>Food: 7<br>Environment: 9<br>Service: 5<br>Cleanliness: 10<br>Price: 7<br><br>Overall: 6

Wtf is wrong with me. I&#39;ve never reviewed my favorite chain resturant.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory Peabody is my favorite place to visit when I just need something nice and familiar to eat. I go there with friends, family, or alone. It&#39;s a clean place with a huge menu. I&#39;ve got my usuals, and when I choose soemthing new, I&#39;m never disappointed. I love the Thai lettuce wraps and the deep-fried avocado rolls. Damn good.<br><br>The drinks are great too. I love the whiskey sours and even the blended shakes. But I go for the food more than for drinks. I&#39;m a big fan of the Pasta Da Vinci, Carbonara and chicken dishes. Cheesecakes are lovely too, but even then I can only handle half or less. Thankfully you can box up whatever you can&#39;t stuff into your face.<br><br>The skinnylicious menu is not my fave, but it is nice to have. I do recommend the agave nectar mojito, it&#39;s really yummy.<br><br>The staff are accomodating, funny and easy to get along with, and always offer a recommendation. I love this place, and I know it&#39;s a chain, but I always feel right at home there.

Although I have never had anything here I haven&#39;t liked, I always end up getting sick later on at night when I&#39;m at home. Still... I like their food. The shepherd&#39;s pie is a great choice, as is their fried chicken salad (ask for extra dressing on the side, though, because it is a little dry). <br><br>The only complaint I have is that their menu is too big. It takes too long to flip through the pages and figure out what in hell I want whenever I&#39;m here.

Love the Cheesecake Factory! I always get two slices after lunch or dinner so that I can take one home with me - my favorite food ever. <br><br>Yes, their food is not that healthy, but when I want to eat out there is really nothing else like it and nothing I want more than some of their comfort food and desert... mmmm love it

Food was really delicious but Jessie our waitress was horrible. I was with my 3 friends and she insulted me and one of my friends saying that we ordered too much food. Then she continued to tell my other friend that she hates him because he paid $2 in change. Money is money. She also asked my other friend if she was talking about her when she was in fact just singing to her boyfriend.  Fantastic food, you can never go wrong at the Cheesecake Factory but very poor service. If you get Jessie as a waitress I suggest just leaving.

BLACK MYSTERY HAIR<br><br>I came here with 2 of my friends. I ordered a Chicken Parm. Sandwich.  I asked for NO peppers.  My sandwich came with peppers, which I would have just picked off but there was a BLACK HAIR on the plate.  GROSS!  I sent the sandwich back and the Waiter took it off the bill and said the manager would come by.  He never did and I left hungry and grossed out.  Like shouldn&#39;t there be precaution&#39;s to avoid this such as HAIR NETS OR WEARING UNDERWEAR TO WORK?   Seriously, I think the manager should have followed up on this health violation.

Sat at bar for dinner around 5:15pm. It was pretty much empty and I was pretty much ignored.  Hard to get a drink. Hard to get my food order...hard to get second drink. Had leftovers...wasn&#39;t even asked if I wanted to take it home. Not good service :(

Normally, I love this place, so at my boyfriend&#39;s request I took him there on April 12, 2017 to celebrate his special day.  My food came 10 minutes before his and without a very important side dish, making me not want to eat it until it arrived.  When the waiter delivered the main dish, I asked for extra applesauce (the side dish I was missing).  15 minutes later he delivered a very tiny bowl filled with little apples, not applesauce.  It was obviously nuked as it was so hot I had to wait to eat it.  I told him that I was supposed to have applesauce.  The manager then came over and gave me some lame excuse that the reason it didn&#39;t come out in time was because it took them a while &#34;to heat it.&#34;  I told the manager that I didn&#39;t enjoy my meal because it was not delivered as promised.  He just said...&#34;oh sorry,&#34; and that was it...no comps for dessert...NOTHING.  Terrible manager.
Sunday brunch is until 2.  Came here at 1 and was seated right away, no lines!  They have an appetizer sweet corn tamale cakes.  You have to try these!  Very yummy.

Horrible wait and rude staff. Never again.  The wait was 45 minutes and that passed then another ten minutes and then another 15 minutes. This is awful. The food isn&#39;t that good that I&#39;ll wait and hour and a half. For that I&#39;ll go to a grocery store and then go home and cook. Thanks for the bad service but for saving the money.  We&#39;ll never be back again!

I don&#39;t like cheesecake, but I love pasta! The Cheesecake Factory probably has the best pasta I have ever tasted. There were times where it was still hard, but I&#39;m glad they can do it over and keep me satisfied. <br><br>I love coming here and won&#39;t stop :)

Our server, Courtnie O, was super attentive and personable and didn&#39;t hover.<br>The food was better than average. The dessert portion was more than enough for two.<br>The atmosphere was conducive to an enjoyable dinner date.  We were sat right away.  Monday&#39;s are a good day/night to stop in.<br>At the end of the dinner the manager, Bobby, came over to hear about our experience. <br>Being a person with a food allergy, he heard how appreciative I was of Courtnie&#39;s attractiveness. <br>I would highly recommend a visit.

I absolutely love the Cheesecake Factory. Although their menu is a labyrinth to navigate through because it is so big, the kitchen is very capable of making all of the dishes well. The dishes are huge too! I&#39;m always stuffed when I go here, which is something of an accomplishment since I&#39;m almost always hungry and have a large appetite. I suppose it&#39;s somewhat of a cliche to enjoy chain restaurants, but I don&#39;t really care when the food is excellent. The best part of this place is of course, the cheesecake. My personal favorite is the key lime cheesecake.

What can I say about TCF. The food comes in huge portions and the menu rarely changes. We were the first people through the door today. The wait staff were walking around in a daze. It took several minutes for staff to come to the front to seat us. I ordered an ice tea and my son ordered a beer. It took at least 10 minutes to receive the drinks. We ordered a appetizer, Cuban sandwich and fish taco. The dishes were very tasty with plenty to take home including slices of Key Lime Cheesecakes which are to die for. Our lunch came to $75 and change plus tip. TCF hasn&#39;t changed.
I tried the chilaquiles on the Sunday brunch menu today -- very good, and the black out cake -- best dessert on the planet if you&#39;re a chocolate lover!!

I have a 9 month old and the waitress asked if she should bring him banana&#39;s and bread- that&#39;s a first!  <br>She brought us our food in perfect timing.  Wasn&#39;t too pushy about ordering anything specific.  The only thing I wasn&#39;t happy about is, she didn&#39;t put a lemon in my water and that&#39;s how I asked for my water.<br><br>I would recommend this location!

Don&#39;t go there on a Sunday night. Before I begin this review has nothing to do with our server, she was great, everything a  server should be, well worth a 25% tip. However, very loud music and now I know why I have a flash light app on my phone. Very dark. With the amount of people there you&#39;d think it would be quicker service. Waited a while for our food and desert. Food was good but the wait...yikes. It was 9 PM. That&#39;s why I try not to go out on Sundays. Again I wish I got the waitress&#39;s name. She was the best.

The only time in my life I have ever left less than a 20% tip. The waitress only took our order and then disappeared. The waiter serving the table next to us was the one that refilled our drinks, another random waitress brought our food out, and our waitress was only seen when it was time to pay. But she took her sweet time coming back for the card. As we were leaving we realized the problem, she was too busy chit chatting at the hostess desk to pay any sort of attention to her tables. Don&#39;t waste your time with this place, there are so many amazing restaurants in the area. Cheesecake factory is over priced and the food isn&#39;t worth it. Go here for cheese cake but only if you don&#39;t feel like driving into Boston, because you will find much better there!

Walked in on a Saturday afternoon with a couple friends. Wait was about 20 minutes. Food was great! Tried a few apps and the luau salad as my meal! We split a couple cheesecakes as well and both were amazing! Salted Carmel and snores cheesecakes are a can&#39;t miss! Can&#39;t ever really go wrong here!
Good selection of wines and food at the bar. The crowd is usually quiet so it&#39;s nice for dinner.

Walked into the restaurant with an open mind.  Server was having a bad day apparently.  Inattentive, grumpy, and short...with talking.  Food was...meh.  Cheesecake was good until we found a long black hair baked into it.  The customer service manager had to asked to come over to the table twice.  When he finally arrived I informed him of the hair and that the rest of the cake should be pulled from the line.  He agreed grabbed the cake and walked away.  He walked up a few minutes later...after we paid...and said that he has to take it off of our bill.  Almost like he was obligated or forced.  Weird...  See needless to say not a very good experience.  I expected better honestly....

Very classy as are all the cheescake factorys :) the menu is a little on the overwhelming side as they offer a million things haha the food is very good but im a little lost on what type if restaurant they are still would recommend them
It use to be my favorite place but my food has stinked everytime I went. The pasta is awful very gross from being too salty to not being cooked. I think for the price it shouldn&#39;t be so yucky

I called a little before 7pm to place an order for take out. I was on hold for 15 minutes before placing an order and being promised it would be ready in 20 minutes. When I go in to pick up, there was a line that took 30 minutes to get to the cashier. Once I got to the register and paid I was told it would be another 10 minutes. That was now 30 minutes after I placed the order. It&#39;s been 15 minutes since then and I still don&#39;t have my food. I ordered take out after working 12 hours and really just wanting to get home, eat and go to bed. If I knew it would take 1.5 hours for a simple take out order I would have gone someplace else else. This is absolutely disgraceful customer service and I will never be back.

Cheesecake Factory is my go-to spot for weekday drinks with the girls. Service is up &amp; down, depending on who is on that night. Usually decent, so we keep coming back.<br><br>I love that the menu is so big -- and I should note that while I say that, I typically order the same thing time and time again, so I don&#39;t even know why a big menu is important. I guess it&#39;s like living near the beach: you don&#39;t always go, but it&#39;s nice to know that it&#39;s there. It&#39;s my menu security blanket, if you will.<br><br>Almost everything I&#39;ve ordered is has been really, really good. Which is impressive coming from (1) a chain (2) a 40-page menu (I mean, how can you get EVERYTHING right?) (3) a more than reasonable price tag. Included in my yummy favs: chicken sliders, factory chopped salad, margherita pizza flatbread, lettuce wraps. <br><br>Things to avoid (IMO): Chicken Pot Stickers (too salty), Pear Feta Arugula Flatbread, Crabcakes. <br><br>Love the whole Skinnylicious menu, but especially the Skinnylicious mojitos. Yum!

I try my best to avoid national chains altogether. To me, The Cheesecake Factory is just a fancier, expensive sit down McDonald&#39;s that serves alcohol with a minimum 30 minute wait; sometimes 1 hour. <br><br>Recently, the chain was sued because they purposely don&#39;t list prices for their adult beverages. It&#39;s appalling to know that after two drinks, the price you pay is more expensive than your meal. <br><br>I don&#39;t understand the fascination about this place. Yes, the food is decent in massive portions. But, I&#39;ve had better for cheaper. And, does this nation truly need massive portions and quantities? Isn&#39;t there an epidemic going on? I&#39;m certainly confused.<br><br>Based on my recent visit, I met with friends who live in the area. To avoid a large tab, I ordered the cheapest listed drink: warm caramel macchiato and an ice water. $5!  <br>(I think that&#39;s even cheaper than a slice of cheesecake.) My service was prompt and pleasant. Well trained, I&#39;ll give him that.<br><br>In all honesty, there isn&#39;t much that impresses me about this place. It&#39;s over priced, waits are usually long, it&#39;s always frigid. Not my cup of tea.<br><br>Why go to the Cheesecake Factory when there are 1000 great restaurants in the area?

This is the 2nd time we visited the Factory - once for breakfast and a second time for dinner.<br><br>I was disappointed both times: the food looked nice but tasted bland. Had I not ordered myself, I could not have told by taste that I was having fish tacos.<br>My family members had the same impression of their food.<br><br>In addition, it was freezing cold inside due to the AC running at full throttle on a day with pleasant 70 degrees outside.<br><br>Don&#39;t think I will come back a third time.

I was SO excited to finally be eating at the Cheesecake Factory!<br>It was our first time and I wanted to love everything. I liked the design of the space and the colors.I expected to love everything but sadly I didn&#39;t. First crab and artichoke dip .Didn;t like it. There wasn&#39;t a hint of crab. I decided on appetisers instead of a dinner.I ordered their version of crab Rangoon,chicken pot stickers and beer battered onion rings. The crab Rangoon was burnt. I sent it back and it was removed from the bill.The onion rings were literally dripping with grease.I couldn&#39;t eat them. I didn&#39;t like the flavor of the potstickers or the sauce.This wasn&#39;t anything wrong on their part, just I didn&#39;t like the flavor at all. I ate two  anyway because I was hungry and mostly because I didn&#39;t want to dampen my husband&#39;s experience.He liked his potatoes but the breaded chicken patties didn&#39;t taste fresh and were greasy. I ordered a piece of key lime cheese cake to go. It tasted extremely bitter and sour! For that price! bummer!  Sad and disappointing all around.

I really like this place! The atmosphere is very nice! It&#39;s clean and nicely decorated. A lot of detail and thought was put into designing this restaurant. I understand that this is a chain restaurant and all the others are probably built like it, but that just means that you won&#39;t be disappointed no matter which one you go to! My only complaint is that the tables are very close together, therefore, you can hear both conversations that are being had on each side of you while you&#39;re eating. The food is very delicious with large portions, and the service is friendly. Oh, and of course, the cheesecake is AMAZING!
I met a class act Mgr Kevin he made me feel like a first class customer my wife and I we&#39;re very impressed by him the service and the food many thanks Dennis Grocki

Terrible service. We have been here numerous times in the past. It used to be quick great service with very good wait staff. Today was a complete disappointing disaster. I had the day off from work with my wife which is a very rare occasion and we decided to go to cheesecake factory for lunch. We had to wait about 10 minutes to even see a waiter. When the waiter came by, my wife wasn&#39;t  ready to order so the waiter came back about 10 minutes later. We gave our order and she asked if we wanted bread and we said yes. So, about 15 minutes later she walked by and said oh you wanted bread? We got bread about 5 minutes later. Then we don&#39;t see her for about 30 to 45 minutes and she came by and said that our order never went through that we would have to wait even longer. She treated it like no big deal. I was pissed and hadn&#39;t eaten all  day. She offered to let us talk to the manager which never happened. She then disappeared yet again. This completely ruined a very rare day off for us. I am so disappointed in the service we received here. I cant believe there was no manager oversight like every other restaurant. Just horrible overall.
One of my all time favorite restaurants.  Excellent food- fish tacos are awesome but there are a lot of other excellent entrees too.  Great service, beautiful décor.

Came in 2 weeks ago with my boyfriend for dinner. Very impressed with the service, pricing, &amp; the portion.  The menu was huge and the even had a low cal menu! I will definitely be coming back..... I also loved the vibe of the restaraunt, it&#39;s beautifully decorated with a modern feel.
This location has had a few missteps today. Service was fine but the kitchen has been missing its mark.
Orange chicken all the way.  Also, the Chinese salad is to die for.  Very good and worth going to if you have never been.

Food was good, server was really nice. At the start there was some confusion with the service though. We had a server come over and take our order for drinks and then a couple minutes later another server came over. Turns out it was a shift change.

Our server Tony who was working the bar area was very pleasant friendly and had many great suggestions! A taller white gentleman who knows more about the food we would like to order than your average waiter. I was very pleased with the service as well as the quality of the food. I&#39;ve been a chef for many years for more restaurants than I can keep track of. However, their recipe for Shrimp Scampi is simply balls to the walls. My fiancé was overly satisfied as well overly stuffed may I add, thanks to the fettuccini Alfredo. Mind you, compliments from us two very well rounded Italians. Now, let&#39;s discuss the pricey bar drinks we ordered...<br>Well you know what, you get what you pay for here. These are not watered down and iced up mixed drinks. Many bars will not serve a Long Island ice tea, or if they do its not made the right way. Order one here! Try not to drive home after 5 of them though.<br>Midori Sour? Excellent! All in all had a great time rang up a $130 bill for two people, and yet I am most certainly happy I chose here. Will be going back soon :)

great desserts but my boss almost killed herself on the GREASY floor near the rest room.  I said something to the hostess as we were walking out and I got a SARCASTIC FAKE sorry and the dude next to her rolled his stupid eyes.  CLEAN your floor jeez your desserts are money makers so use that $ to CLEAN your floor.  Do you want a lawsuit from someone who falls?  I&#39;m not the type to sue but someone else will be.  Take heed and do the right thing. It&#39;s like a skating rink.

Place is always packed because of the clientele being on the younger side and traffic from the malls. Waiters are horrible. Drinks are good. I got served over cooked steak and then asked for it to be changed to the pork chop that came out raw. The food is always overcooked or under, stay safe with burgers, pastas, and salads. Otherwise, eat at your own risk. The drinks are good but way over priced compared to what you can get at surrounding restaurants with better service and quality.

Went last night with two friends and three kids under the age of 8.  Decent food for a chain, HUGE portions - I got three meals out of my order of Chicken Piccata.  We also got a burger with sweet potato fries.  And Thai Lettuce Wraps, which is an appetizer, had such a large portion, that it was perfect for dinner size.  The kids got burgers with fries.  <br><br>Our waitress was nice and attentive.  The cheesecakes we had were delicious - original with strawberry, red velvet, and pina colada, but needed to walk around the mall after eating them.  Lol.

You&#39;ll probably love the food, but you&#39;ll hate the wait. I&#39;m talking up to 90 minutes on a Friday or Saturday night (eek!). However, the menu is ridiculously comprehensive, and there is absolutely something for everybody.  Most of the food is outstanding for a chain restaurant of this magnitude. The food prices are ok, if not a little high, but the drink prices are wayyyyy too expensive. Do your wallet a favor and don&#39;t drink here. <br><br>Our favorite food: the burger sliders, all the salads, and the spicy chicken chipotle pasta<br>Our favorite drink: the white sangria<br><br>We liked the Cambridge and Boston locations much more than this one, so if you live close to those, go there instead.

For an 8pm crowd, the restaurant was busy and very loud. The food and drinks were grossly overpriced for the quality. While the waitstaff around us seemed friendly and engaging, our waiter was about as interesting as dry Bisquick. He was slow, never smiled, and barely asked us how our food or experience was. We got more attention out of a waitress from another station who offered to come over and clear our dinner plates.

Best part of the Cheesecake Factory is their extensive menu.  <br><br>Sad they got rid of the Navajo Sandwich.  it was the best item on their menu!!!<br><br>Recently I ordered the curbside and was seriously disappointed with the meal.  There was NO food!  Cheesecake is known for large portions.  Hope they&#39;re not scrimping!

Went in last night (Wednesday) and waited about 5-10 minutes to be seated during peak dinner time. I&#39;ve had great service at other cheesecakes but at this one it was pretty awful. Our waitress was nice and would have done a decent job if she had better time management. After we sat down it took 15 minutes to be greeted, another 15 for her to bring our drinks and ask what we wanted but we had questions for the kitchen so it took even longer to put the order in but I didn&#39;t take note of the time at that point. It then took 15 minutes from getting the drinks to get bread. The food finally came out 50ish minutes after we sat down. I want to give her the benefit of the doubt and I&#39;m assuming she&#39;s new based off how she handles her tables. The tables around us with different servers were getting much better service (table next to us&#39; server went over twice before she even brought us our drinks). We considered not even getting desert because we didn&#39;t want to tack on another 15 minutes. Don&#39;t go here if you want to be out in under an hour and a half.

News flash: The Cheesecake Factory is not a fancy restaurant.<br><br>It amazes me how many people think it is and come to this place decked out in their Sunday&#39;s best. It&#39;s forgivable, I understand, look at their fancy website, the bigass columns and Egyptian-esque artwork, the way the food is plated, shit the wait staff wears ties for godsakes. But really, anywhere that sells mac n cheese bites, corn dogs and burgers topped with pulled pork can not be considered fancy. In fact, I would barely even consider this place a restaurant. This place is a monument to American excess and gluttony, so leave the ties, fancy skirts and cuff-links at home and bring your stretchiest sweatpants and a hoody to cover the shame you&#39;re going to feel when you finish eating here. <br><br>It&#39;s important to remember when you come here that the the goal isn&#39;t to have an enjoyable meal, no sir. The Cheesecake Factory challenges you to stuff as much shit into your mouth as you possibly can and still have room for dessert. This place doesn&#39;t make it easy because the portions of everything are stupidly huge. Oh, and there&#39;s like 100 appetizers and they all look good so sack up and order a few to go with the free bread they give you (which is delicious).<br><br>The last time I went here I ordered a burrito and thing was literally the size of my forearm and came with a big side of black beans and sour cream. I couldn&#39;t tell you what was in it or even how good it was, I could barely remember by the time I finished the thing. Oh yeah, you bet your ass I finished the thing, The Factory threw down the gauntlet when they put that thing on my table and I had to answer the challenge. I finished my meal off with red velvet cheesecake because it&#39;s the cheesecake factory and if you don&#39;t get cheesecake at the end of your meal you&#39;re an asshole. A slice is about the size of your head and yeah, it&#39;s good, really good, for a place called the Cheesecake Factory it damn well better be. <br><br>An important side note to remember is that the size of the menu here rivals the goddamn bible. This place seriously has everything ever and the reason why the wait is always so long is because it takes about 2 hours to figure out what the hell you want. It&#39;s great if you have a date that is a picky eater and can&#39;t figure out where you want to go for dinner. It&#39;s also a good test because if she can&#39;t find something she likes she&#39;s way too high maintenance and you should ditch her ass. Honestly, it&#39;s probably for the better because the time you are done with this place you are going to have trouble walking and breathing and probably weren&#39;t going to get laid anyway.
BEST SERVICE in MA!  Our food was served on time and the service was the friendliest for a busy place on Mother&#39;s Day!!

Getting into the restaurant can be tough. The mall is very busy and you might have to park a little bit far away. We went on a Saturday afternoon and finding parking was a bit annoying.<br><br>We (a party of three) had to wait less than 5 minutes to get a table despite the restaurant being packed. I was impressed with the short wait. The greeter guy was a friendly introduction to the restaurant.<br><br>The decor in the restaurant was nice. It was fancy in my eyes. We found ourselves commenting on the decor every so often. <br><br>The waiter was great. We knew he was extremely busy; the restaurant was full. He brought us our drinks right away and was courteous. My sister got crispy chicken sliders. She asked for some extra sauces on the side which she got. I tried one of the sliders and it was great. Crispy, tender, and flavorful chicken. No complaints there. <br><br>I had a a barbecue chicken salad. It was phenomenal. The lettuce was crisp; none of it was wilted. It had flavorful, tender grilled chicken and crispy fried onion strings. It was an expensive dish at $15. I should have gotten the lunch sized portion because this salad was huge. <br><br>My girlfriend got a lunch sized salad similar to mine. She enjoyed it, also commenting that the veggies tasted fresh. We both ended up with leftovers. <br><br>We had a Hersey chocolate cheesecake with chocolate chips. It was rich, sweet, and flavorful. <br><br>They basically forced me to give them a 5/5. The staff was friendly attentive. They did all the little things like extra water refills, politeness, and attentiveness. The service was quick even though the place was so busy which I thought was remarkable. The food was exceptional. Maybe it was our lucky day, but this lunch was perfect. Only gripe would be the high prices, but with good staff, food, and ambiance, it is worth it.

Very disappointed with The eggs Benedict. After our party consumed six drinks made by the impeccable bartender, Brittney, we should of left...eggs hard, hardly any hollandaise sauce, and the manager did nothing other than to offer another dish made when everyone was done eating. Don&#39;t think I will ever go back...tired of giving this place second chances for their food. There are plenty of places that make good drinks...work on your kitchen!

By far our favorite restaurant in the Northshore Mall area. The food is always great. The service can be slow even when there&#39;s not very many people there. If your bread isn&#39;t warm be sure to ask for a warm batch.

Had a great Mother&#39;s Day lunch dinner with my mom and dad. Our server Kayla was awesome very attentive to our needs and was right on top of everything. Food was great I had the Kobe burger cooked perfect mom had pasta which she loved. Make sure when you go you treat your servers well, they work hard on special days like today (Mother&#39;s Day) thanks again Kayla for making it a good dinner

Table for 2 on a quite Thursday afternoon &amp; the service was like it was a busy weekend dinner. I don&#39;t understand why everything took so long. My son had the chicken Marsala which was a huge plate, but he had no problem knocking it out. I had the grilled chicken avocado club w/ fries, the club was very tasty but so sloppy to eat I needed a napkin for my napkin.
Friends and I eat here when we get the chance. Sometimes the wait is a little long but the food and service is great :) our waitress Chantal was amazing!

The food is great ... it&#39;s just getting there that&#39;s the problem. We were told the wait was 20 minutes when we arrived. After 30 minutes we started noticing people getting called ahead of us. I finally asked the hostess if we were forgotten and she assured me we were next. We then watched 3 other couples get called up and seated with me standing right there. 45 minutes later we finally get seated because I had to ask again.<br><br>I would rather a restaurant is honest with me and tells me up front I&#39;m going to be waiting an hour rather than lowballing so I might stay. This happened in my previous visit as well although I wasn&#39;t waiting as long.<br><br>Moral of the story? Go here for great food but prepare to wait a lot longer than you are told. Also be sure to check in regularly to see if they forgot to seat you.

Overall, I rate the &#34;chain&#34; at a 3 or a 4... but this PARTICULAR location (Northshore Mall) rates much lower.<br><br>I base my critique on several visits (it&#39;s tough to condemn a place on one or even two bad experiences).<br><br>Negatives:<br><br>- Menu: (chain-wide) If I have to fault the Cheesecake chain, I would say that the over-extensive menu dominated by advertisements is a major turnoff... as is the overwhelming number of food choices. Sometimes, less is more.<br><br>- Cleanliness: A VERY disappointing common thread of our visits was cleanliness. It was almost comical (almost). Over the span of several (up to a dozen?) visits, we would almost ALWAYS have at least one utensil (usually more) with dried food encrusted on it, the glasses usually had food particles stuck on them and/or arrived VERY sticky from sloppy beverage dispensing, two of the times (yes, TWO) we had lipstick stains on the water glass and one time, lipstick stains on the white coffee mug. About 1/2 the time, the tables were BARELY wiped down... sticky residue, crumbs, it just got ridiculous.<br><br>- Food: MOST of the time, the food was satisfactory or better, but there were a few times where it was just plain unacceptable.<br><br>As of this writing, it has been over 2-years since we&#39;ve returned. Things MAY have gotten better. I cannot comment on their current assessment. I may give them another chance soon - just because.<br><br>What they do very well (obviously) is the Cheesecake. Heck, it&#39;s in their name... I&#39;d hope so. When prepared properly... On CLEAN plates and glasses, the food is good.<br><br>---<br><br>Update: FAIL!<br>I tried their curbside takeout and went with something REALLY easy. One of their special cheeseburgers but asked them to hold the ranch dressing, cooked medium, fries, slice of cheesecake. Picked up my food, when I got home, the burger was between rare &amp; med/rare, there was ranch dressing on the burger, and they forgot to put the fries in the container even thou I paid for them. Again, the cheesecake slice was just fine, but the burger (which should have been a no brainer) was a disappointment. How many more chances do I need to give them?

I normally do not like chain restaurants but I will eat at a Cheesecake factory again. Last night their was a half hour wait for a table, the place was packed and the service and food did not miss a beat.  Recommendations all around here,

Oh a great experience.  Wife and daughtar ordered the orange chicken. Chicken was soggy and saturated with grease. Ordered something different burgers took a long time were just okay. The bill came and they charged us fur a more expensive burger took 15 minutes to fix my bill. The restaurant was dead. Not a great experience the second time in two weeks.

Pros: We always enjoy the food. My mom gets Renee&#39;s lunch special, which includes a chicken salad or turkey sandwich, a side salad, and soup. I got the turkey club. Our waiter Todd was helpful, and the person who delivered our food was funny. My water was refilled frequently.<br><br>Con: The seating!  It wasn&#39;t busy during lunch on a Thursday, but that put us at a tiny table for two. This was forgivable...I think it was just me. However, they then proceeded to surround us with two other parties with about 18 inches between the tables. There was plenty of space to leave at least one table between different groups. It was awkward. I can understand the squishing if it&#39;s crowded, but it wasn&#39;t. I took off a star because of this.<br><br>We&#39;ll go back, but next time I&#39;ll ask for a booth to avoid the overcrowding.

Great service, fun wait staff, and good food makes this a nice place. But boy do they jam everyone into small places. Hey, I am 6&#39; 4&#34; and 200 lbs. You would think they could accommodate me. And they really were herding us to keep us moving. Sorrythis was more of a cattle call than a fine dining experience.

Food was pretty good. On par with other cheesecake factories. Service was good. Our waitress checked up drinks and food on a routinely basis. 3 stars because my patron&#39;s on ice were quite lacking in flavor

Cheesecake! Mmmmm....Good.....!<br><br>I really don&#39;t understand what all the fuss is about concerning the Cheesecake Factory? I am not a fan of any place where the wait time is more than 15 minutes. It must be my ADD working. So I decided to plan a pre-lunch raid on the local CF at North Shore mall. My first impression is wow this place is really tall from the doors to the walls. The hostess was very bubbly as she sat me down for lunch. The waiter was very professional and did a great job.<br><br>The CF menu is like the bible only larger. I am not joking. The offerings are all over the place so you can&#39;t say you can&#39;t find SOMETHING you would like to eat. <br><br>I decided to try the lunch portion of Beer Battered Fish and Chips. It came out fairly quickly from the kitchen. The fish was just right in terms of portion and a huge pile of shoestring fries. The coleslaw was just a glob of disappointment after one bite it was swiftly placed aside. I would say my lunch was just ok. <br><br>Now no visit to the CF would be complete without grabbing some cheesecake. I mean come on. It is like going to a baseball game and not grabbing a beer and hot dog or getting a massage without a happy ending! The dessert menu was just as stocked with delicious choices. Who knew they could make so many types of cheesecakes. I decided to go with the Turtle Cheesecake to go. This piece of cheesecake was packed to go delicately and weighed a ton. I walked to my car with my left arm hanging slightly down. <br><br>The cheesecake was very rich and tasty causing a sudden spike in the  insulin levels in my body. I swore I was going to become a diabetic eating it! Damn it was good! <br><br>I can&#39;t say that this would become a regular place but if you are out for a sugar fix. The CF would make a nice score.

Ok, I know this is a new location for the Cheesecake and I wen there on their third day of opening.  But COME ON, it was 3pm on a Friday.  Hardly anyone is there and the host staff still manages to take half hour to seat us.  We walk up and request a table for two, fine.  The host starts looking at her stupid screen and hands over a piece of paper with our table number on it to some other host.  The first host says, &#34;she&#39;ll be right with you.&#34;  So we wait, and wait, and wait.  <br><br>Finally, I&#39;m like &#34;what&#39;s going on, parties of 4 that just walked in are being sat before us.&#34;  She looks confused and says, &#34;OH, sorry Hold on&#34; and comes back and tells us our host is dealing with a difficult customer.  This should have been a sign to leave now.  <br><br>The original host that was supposed to seat us keeps looking over at us and rolling her eyes, &#34;uhhh seriously?&#34;  Are you jealous of the girl I was with?  Why do girls act like this? <br><br> FInally some guy seats us.  While our waitress was friendly, my lunch portion salad must have had a bottle of dressing on it.  It was basically soup with lettuce in it.  Gross.  I couldn&#39;t finish it.  3 stars because I *think* they&#39;ll get better with practice.

Came to the Cheesecake Factory for lunch on our way to Gloucester. We had several issues here. One being the staff. Our waitress was so grumpy and made us feel like we were inconveniencing her. Then the food came. My child&#39;s spaghetti was fine, with one small meatball. My mother in law got some chicken thing with a side of pasta, it was more salt and pasta than chicken. I ordered their Margarita pizza. The crust was obviously previously frozen the cheese was so over cooked it was gummy. It was gross. Last but not least, the temperature. It was like a meat locker in there. It was so cold and uncomfortable. Couldn&#39;t wait to get out. Never again going back.

This location does a good job, but somehow I feel like the food is better at the Burlington location.<br><br>Everything is good and they have a nice space with patio.  Service can sometimes be not so great but it is normally okay.  Their small apps are great and not too expensive.

I&#39;ve ate here or at this food chain several times now. I still think the food is good, maybe even great. The portion is more than generous. I&#39;ve seen the monster salads, but I have never ordered them since I fear eating salad in a public place when I am such a tiny person and fear that spectators would think that I am on a strict diet or have some sort of eating disorder. lol. But wouldn&#39;t it be strange to be on a diet and have such a monstrous salad, one in which you can&#39;t even see the eyes of the person sitting accross from you? Lol. I am over exaggerating. <br><br>Let&#39;s see, the first time I went here I went in a large group with my boyfirend and his co-workers. I ordered a virgin pina coloda. I didn&#39;t feel like showing my id. I swear, it sucks sometimes to look like you are under 21. For my main entree, I had the bistro shrimp pasta. I like to try shrimp dishes first, then beef, then chicken when I try new places. I prefer seafood over poultry. I liked my dish. I didn&#39;t absolutely love it, but I was having a good time and I enjoyed the busy restaurant atmosphere and wanted to come back. I tried my boyfirend&#39;s hibachi steak dish and it was not so good though. I agreed with him that it was a bit chewy and a terribly small portion. The mushroom tasted...gritty, like it wasn&#39;t cleaned properly. The wasabi mash potatoes was plentiful but it was also very dry. What is the point of serving a lot of unedible mashpotatoe? I&#39;d rather be served a small portion that was excellent and be left wanting more.  As for service, service was not so good. The cook messed up one of my bf&#39;s co-workers order. The waiters were not sympathetic. They came out of the kitchen with a plate with dry chicken pieces on it and ask us to toss it in with the bow tie pasta. Tisk, tisk. And a very long wait for a table.<br><br>The second time I went here I went with my boyfriend and his best friend and his girlfriend. I had and liked a lot the spicy chicken chipotle pasta. It was very tasty. I love the asparagus in it, it was like a treat. Sorry, I love my vegetables.  Let&#39;s see, I love their deserts. Who doesn&#39;t? Cheesecake. Yum. Fresh strawberry. Yum. Actually, the second time I went to the Cheesecake Factory, I went to the one in Burlington. The wait was longer but our waitress was nice and the food seemed to taste better. Maybe I got lucky this time and ordered the right stuff.<br><br>I have tried the canjun Jambalaya pasta twice. It is absolutely spicy goodness. The first time I didn&#39;t like it because my chicken was overcooked and dry, but the second time when I had it in Braintree, MA adjacent to the South Shore Mall, it was supberb. The chicken was super juicy. If you love spicy, this dish is the one. I highly recommend this. I rate this over the spicy chicken chipotle pasta.

I absolutely love the cheesecake factory! Their avocado egg rolls are to die for! Staff was super friendly and service was fast! Food was delicious! Easy to find.  Menu was huge.. A lot to choose from! A great spot to go with the family!

Only 3 stars here, because 5 of my friends and I waited 2 hours for a table Saturday night.  I do not understand why, when this place has been open for months now, there is still a 2 hour wait!!!<br><br>I have always liked the food here.  I have been to the Burlington and Prudential locations several times. They have a huge menu selection, and taking the cheesecake &#34;to go&#34; after dinner is the best part. The one down side was that because we were seated at 9 p.m.,  they were out of a lot of flavors of cheesecake. <br><br>You&#39;ll pay a bit more than your average restaurant, but the portion sizes are huge and make it worth every penny. Be warned that if you order a &#34;small garden salad&#34; you could pretty much eat it as a regular meal. I took like 2 bites and had to call it quits so I wouldn&#39;t be too full for dinner. <br><br>On the up side, its at the mall, so I DID find ways to entertain myself while waiting for the buzzer to go off.

Had a great experience tonight at the Cheesecake. We&#39;ve been to multiple Cheesecake Factory locations but tonight&#39;s visit was worth a positive review.  We arrived around 6 pm on a Sat. evening and expected a wait of over an hour but were told 15-20 minutes, which was true.  We were seated within 20 minutes and our lovely waitress came over immediately. During our wait, we had reviewed the menu so knew immediately what we wanted to order.  We started with the Skinny Artichoke appetizer which included two artichoke halves, grilled and served with a mayo/aoli dip (delicious).  I have never had artichokes before served this way and must say it was great!.  I ordered the Skinny Mexican Tortilla Salad and my husband, the Skinny Chinese Chicken Salad.  Our waitress offered and brought bread, which I love!  The restaurant was quite busy so it took a little longer (than other experiences we have had at Cheesecake&#39;s) for our meals to arrive but not unreasonable based on the volume.   Our meals were excellent and hit the spot.  The only disappointing fact about this chain are the many entrees that are loaded with calories ...and watching the many diners who probably should be ordering from the &#34;skinny&#34; menu chow down on poor choices.   Hate to pass judgment but I wish the menu posted the calorie counts on the face on the menu for those who don&#39;t have a clue about making better choices.  The Skinny Menu is a great idea and surprisingly offers many delicious options.

First off I never write bad reviews.  I actually created a Yelp account to write this I feel so strongly about it.  The Cheesecake Factory in Peabody is an atrocity of a restaurant.  Even though it&#39;s a chain their food is very tasty and I do enjoy my meals when they&#39;re made correctly.  The problems come with the way this location is managed.  It all seems to come down to the kitchen staff and not following directions and not caring to make something right.  Tonight I ordered the Tuscan Chicken as a to go order for dinner.  Getting someone to answer the phone at the bakery is hard enough so usually I&#39;m irritated by the time my order is placed.  I don&#39;t understand why they can&#39;t staff one more person in that area or have one person solely in charge of to go orders.  Or why the girls making the cheesecakes aren&#39;t allowed to use the operating system on the computers.  This would speed things up a lot during peak hours.  Anyways, I have had issues with this meal before so I know to ask for extra farrow because it does not come with a lot (which is fine I don&#39;t mind paying more for something I want).  When I went to pick up my order there was no farrow which has happened more than once.  When they substitute in the computer they put &#39;no farrow&#39; and under it &#39;extra farrow&#39; so it is definitely confusing however I&#39;m sure the kitchen gets substitutions all day long.  It should be one of those things they are looking at carefully when reading over a ticket.  The nice girl at the bakery said she would go get them to put more farrow on and she did.  So I paid and left and when I went to eat my meal (which is very tasty.. That&#39;s why I keep getting it) I took a bite of the farrow and it was ice cold.  Whoever handled it in the kitchen took some extra from the refrigerator and threw it in my to go container without heating it up at all.  If I wanted cold rice or farrow I could  have definitely found that in my own fridge at home.  I was on a time limit so I didn&#39;t have the energy or time to go fight with them over this otherwise I would have.  Not that that would make any difference.  I had another order about a year ago that I had asked for extra sauce on my pasta and when I got home which is in another town I realized they put no sauce on my food.  Just plain pasta noodles.  When I called to talk to a manager he said they would refund my meal to my debit card and he never did.  Clearly this restaurant doesn&#39;t give two F&#39;s about a good experience because these are repeat issues that I know happen to more than just myself.  Do yourself a favor and skip this restaurant and go somewhere else where you&#39;ll be heard and taken care of.  I work in customer service and I still can&#39;t get over how horrible this place is.  I won&#39;t be going back it&#39;s not worth it.

Within the past couple of months I&#39;ve ended up here at least on two separate occasions. I tend to have a habit of waiting until I&#39;m absolutely starving and just diving into the first restaurant I see. A little hazardous I must say. <br><br>As a chain, you can pretty much expect the same thing every time you go here. Luckily I haven&#39;t had to wait any obscene amount of time, but the waitstaff is never exceptional. <br><br>Yesterday I ordered the fettuccine and sun dried tomatoes pasta, which was really quite tasty, but instead of chicken I asked for shrimp. My waiter asked me if I wanted 3 or 4, seeing as how it was a one shrimp difference I didn&#39;t quite think it was a big deal saying 4. It wasn&#39;t like 5.. or lets say 10. <br><br>When I got the bill they had charged me $7 for the 4 shrimp. A little absurd. Had I known that I would have gone with the 3. I suppose he was just trying to make money since I ordered the lunch size dish. The shrimp wasn&#39;t even that tasty. <br><br>After our waiter man dropped off the check, I sat for a good 10 minutes while he stood at his station staring at me. Maybe he was just swamped at 2:30 on a Monday...

I have never had a bad meal at the Cheesecake Factory...until today. I ordered a pasta dish which came with watery, soupy sauce and overcooked noodles. I didn&#39;t think you could mess up pasta, but apparently you can! The waiter asked if I wanted to pack it bc I didn&#39;t eat it and I explained it wasn&#39;t good. What&#39;s worse is the waiter didn&#39;t take it off the check, even after we had to order another meal to take home. He seemed new and nervous so my husband and I didn&#39;t want to get into the whole &#34;get the manager&#34;bit, but every restaurant  I&#39;ve ever been to automatically does if you aren&#39;t happy! I&#39;m so disappointed, never thought I&#39;d say that about my once favorite place.

I only end up here when trying to please many people. I&#39;m not a huge fan of restaurants that have over 200 menu items... but I suppose there is something to be said for the convenience. <br><br>I&#39;m never impressed with the quality of food, but ya know, to me it&#39;s no different than Olive Garden, Friday&#39;s, Chili&#39;s etc.. nothing special.<br><br>I&#39;ve always had good service though.

Usually pretty good when I go but not tonight. Went specifically for the Mac n cheese bites and they were sold out.. not their fault but that sucks. Ordered potato tots, had to wait at least 5min after getting them just to ask for ketchup and one of them was completely brown and burnt. Also got buffalo blasts.. 3 out of the 5 were also brown and burnt, clearly their oil needs to be changed, nasty. but we ate the ones we could and they were good. Our meals came and I got chicken picatta no mushrooms. Found 4 pieces of mushrooms, not a big deal cause I&#39;m not allergic, just annoying. The worst part, my angel hair was tangled all in a big clump stuck together, couldn&#39;t even eat it. Over all, I&#39;d say they need to have an expeditor that cares a whole lot more.

Lunch at the CF in Peabody was enjoyable. Though the noise level is annoying and a major negative.. Love the decor. Menu is so large one does not have time to look at it all and truly decide on what you might really like to order if it&#39;s your 1st time. ***Wish they would have a special weekly or monthly buffet by reservation only so that diners could try a number of items on their huge menu. ***GOOD IDEA***  :) I ordered from the lunch options and had a delicious, yet small portion of grilled salmon. It was accompanied by a disappointing portion of only 4 mini broccoli florets (tops only for non broccoli fans) and their signature mashed potatoes that someone had added an excessive amount of black pepper to prior to serving. WHOA! If I had the extra time I would have sent the plate back and requested no pepper be added. My server was tired, but quite personable. If you are looking for a relaxing atmosphere, the cheesecake factory is not the right choice. Do take out.  IF you are looking for an eye catching interior, high energy, LOUD, yet decent food and decadent dessert, then you have found your destination. Not inexpensive. Entree and dessert, no beverage plus tip ran $30 for one.  ENJOY!

The food is always fantastic but my daughter just returned from eating with 2 friends and the waitress brought the wrong meal and then it took 25 minutes for her to return with the correct meal, long after her friends had finished their meal.  An apology was given but no offer for a complimentary meal which given the circumstances, I believe would have been appropriate.  It makes you wonder if it were three adults if the outcome would have been different.

Honesty just a shitty experience probably won&#39;t ever come back to this location. Took us over 45 minutes to get our food, and we ordered a dish to go while we ordered our food. Every time we said excuse me to our waiter Jennifer C she just walked away, maybe if she spent less time chatting with her friends at another table... finally ordered cheesecakes and said it&#39;s for the birthday boy because we heard lots of people being sung to and we were brought our cake with no happy birthday. Finally our check came and she didn&#39;t put our to go meal in so we had to wait even longer for that meal she said it was &#34;so crazy&#34; but if you looked around the place was almost empty.... we heard more people being sung happy birthday to so I stood up and yelled YA HAPPY BIRTHDAY FROM THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY to my friend and Jennifer came over and said &#34;did someone take away her coke yet???&#34; So rude will probably never come back after this experience what a shame.

I am partial to smaller restaurants which may be why I was not a fan of the cheesecake factory.<br>We went on a Saturday afternoon and there was a wait.  My friend wanted to try it so we did wait the <br>20 minutes.   When we were sat at our table, I could tell right away that it wasn&#39;t cleaned properly from<br>the last patrons.  Still crumbs on our seats... and the side of the table was a little sticky.  After waiting 10 minutes for our waiter/waitress to come over and they never did, we left.

When they opened a TCF at Northshore Mall my mom and I were overjoyed.  We used to love this restaurant but hated having to go al the way to Burlington.  Now we don&#39;t like it as much.  BTW I don&#39;t like Cheesecake and that is never my reason to go.<br><br>The GOOD:<br><br>-huge selection of dishes (highly recommend the Chinese Chicken Salad)<br>-huge portions of said dishes<br>-generally very friendly staff<br>-beautiful decor and lighting<br>-right next to the mall<br>-nice music<br><br>The BAD:<br><br>-no reservations<br>-can be very noisy when there are a lot of people<br>-take-out is unpredictable and sometimes horrible<br>-pricey<br>-sometimes I have to pray and do Hail Marys and hope that they give my family and I a booth seating rather than those rickety chairs and the table <br>-often notice flies around the kitchen area<br><br>The UGLY:<br><br>Seriously, this restaurant is always crowded with people.  I think people secretly live there.  The only time I&#39;ve ever seen the restaurant dead empty was when the Pats faced the Giants in the Super Bowl.  Total ghosttown, but complete heaven-on-earth for us :)  No wait time, we got to pick our own seating, our food came in no time.<br><br>Also, the wait time for a table can be ridiculous.  Sometimes we&#39;ve waited for 2 hours for a table.<br><br>Even when ordering over the phone for takeout I&#39;ve waited for 30 min. at times.  I suggest dining in as opposed to take-out.
Food is pretty good! Prices are okay. My two highlights for this restaurant are they breakfast all day, and their menu is huge! The biggest downside is the wait, really

I came here today with my mother after a somewhat stressful morning with the toddler trying to get last minute Christmas stuff done and seeing Santa, the Santa is where it was stressful but this is about The Cheesecake Factory so let&#39;s continue...<br><br>We got there at the beginning of lunch around 11:30 and were pleased to be seated immediately. My mother who had tried on numerous occasions to come to several different Cheesecake Factories was impressed that it wasn&#39;t a three hour wait. Apparently she doesn&#39;t understand the fine art of having lunch there, well now she does! <br><br>With toddler in tow and hungry bellies we looked over the menu and were pleased to find several lunch options which I thought would be much smaller portions but to our happy surprise were HUGE. They also brought out a small plate of sliced bananas and bread for the kid to munch on as well as a small cup of milk. Both of which went over great.<br><br>As I mentioned we got lunch sized meals. I ordered a Pizza and Salad Lunch meal and could not believe how huge both items were. The pizza was really good and the salad was loaded with all kinds of greens and veggies. I had to take both home!<br><br>My mother got Baja Chicken Tacos and the meal came with a generous sides of black beans, rice and assorted veggies. It also was 3 tacos large and she couldn&#39;t finish it at all. <br><br>All in all the meal was perfect. Our waitress, Ashley, was awesome and luckily because the kid is so social she was more than pleased with the laid back atmosphere.<br><br>This is my favorite Cheesecake Factory and after this experience it seals the deal.

I have to say the first time I went to Cheesecake I was surprised.  All my friends rave to no end how end how awesome it is.<br><br>First of, Cheesecake is really tall, when you walk in it reminds you of Disney World--almost tacky but thought out ambiance.  We did not make a reservation, being a Friday night I thought it we would have to wait at least a half an hour.  After 15 minutes we were promptly seated and confronted with a menu that rivals the Da Vinci Code.  Granted they did have advertisements plastered on every other page, nevertheless they have a plethora of options to choose from.<br><br>The best way to describe the staff is somewhat orderly chaos.  Our waiter made no effort to spend a second more than he had to with us.  Also he was rather difficult to flag down when we wanted to change our order.<br><br>Good food can just about make up for any bad qualities a restaurant can retain.  Not only is the food quite good, you get a lot of it.  The salmon I recall correctly was not farmed and surprisingly for a chain they did not over cook it.  <br><br>Now we could not go to Cheesecake and not get some cheesecake, I had their 40th anniversary cheesecake--half and half chocolate and vanilla split into 1/4ths.  Not the best cheesecake I have had on the planet, but overall the entire experience is worth it and makes for a nice meal/evening.  If you want fine dining, look elsewhere but if you want a sort of cheesy ambiance and decent food do not miss the Cheesecake Factory.

Over the last year or so this place has really gone down hill. Slow service. loud, bland servers and too much transferring tables from one server to another, portions sizes have also gone way down on just about everything (especially the sandwiches/burgers items) and I agree that the food overall has Not been good... It&#39;s just not as fresh and flavorful as one other reviewer wrote. Last few times I&#39;ve been here food tastes like it&#39;s been leftover/sitting in the pick up window for at least 10 - 15 minutes. This Peabody location Used to be one of the best Cheesecake locations to go to - Not anymore. Hopefully they&#39;ll get their act together or they&#39;re going to be another failure like a lot of these restaurants today that start out great for a while, and then go down like a German airplane. Consistency folks!!!!

I am a fan of Cheese cake.  I know they are a chain and I go to several in the Seattle area often where I live.  They are all the same but then you know the level of food and service to expect which is great!  This factory I have been to several times because I come out to the Peabody area often.  It is always busy so that should tell you something.  The food is good and the selection like all factories is one of the largest.  <br>The service was great and always prompt.<br>It is located in the Northshore Mall and a great place to hit for lunch or dinner after a full day of shopping.   <br>I am a big fan of the roasted artichokes and always get them.  I like the upscale eclectic decor too!<br>We had lunch and our waitperson, a young man from New Hampshire had the coolest accent.  He was so much fun and added a lot to the meal.  <br>I love to try different restaurants but when I am busy,  need a nice predictable place, at a good price,  I often choose Cheese Cake.  <br>This one is in my GPS for sure !

While the service can be hit-or-miss, they don&#39;t take reservations, and the wait times are ridiculous, I do enjoy the food.  My favorites are the Miso Salmon and the Grilled Chicken and Avocado Club sandwich.  The menu is overwhelmingly large, and I&#39;ve only tried a few other dishes, usually defaulting to my faves, which are always guaranteed to be good.  The cheesecake is good, very rich, and if I do opt for a piece (which is rare), I will split it with whoever I&#39;m with.  <br><br>Whatever you do, avoid the Buffalo Wings.  Unless of course you like insane 10-alarm heat and a numb tongue for the rest of the night!  You&#39;ve been warned.

If I could give this place a minus one star I would. Had lunch with my daughter saw a lot of bugs flying around had one fly in my bread when I was eating it could not eat my dinner after that this place was so gross!

Where do I start? My family and I came here to eat a quick lunch/dinner after we found out PF Changs next door recently closed. Since we don&#39;t live nearby, we always grab a few slices of cheesecake before we leave, but we don&#39;t usually eat in. We decided what the heck, let&#39;s do it. So we went in and after admiring the eye opening cheesecake display we waited to be seated. After finding the hostess, she took our name and told us it would be a few minutes. We got seated in a booth that had food underneath it so the young women swept it up before we sat down. A few minutes later, our waiter came over and asked what we wanted to drink. We then looked at the menu and ordered. I tried to order the $19.95 Seared Ahi Tuna, but, of course, they were out of Tuna. I then ordered the grilled salmon. When the food finally arrived, it was quite bland and didn&#39;t have much flavor. I think I ate more of the bread we were given than my actually dish. After the disappointing food, we ordered cheesecake and hoped for something. I ordered the Oreo Extreme Cheesecake with hot fudge on the side. This came pretty quick and looked pretty good. After eating about half and saving the rest for home, I got the 85 dollar bill. With tip, this $100 dollar dinner was not worth any of it. If I could&#39;ve given this experience 0 stars I would&#39;ve if I didn&#39;t have the cheesecake. All in all, the Cheesecake Factory should stick to cheesecake and that&#39;s it. We will not be going back to eat in there anytime soon.

Came here with my girlfriend to grab a quick bite for dinner. The cheesecake factory never ceases to disappoint me. We ordered the Miso Salmon for her and the Moroccan Chicken for myself. After 20 minutes of waiting, a manager came by and apologized for the wait. I began to say that it was okay, and she proceeded to say that the wrong size salmon had been cooked and it&#39;d fallen apart. She went back, and after 20 more minutes we received our food. I was excited to try my Moroccan chicken, yet it was so dry, I felt as if I were sawing a piece of wood. They had obviously left my food at the hot line for the whole twenty minutes it took them to remake my girlfriend&#39;s salmon. I sent the food back, and waited about 10 minutes for another plate. I&#39;m giving an extra star because the server was helpful and sweet. Don&#39;t waste your time here. Go to a non-chain restaurant.
Not happy went to get my favorite there spaghetti &amp; meat sauce and they took it off the menu...

I was happy with my experience here. I got a meal takeout after being at an appointment at the hospital near by. The staff were pleasant although they didn&#39;t really approach me, I had to ask where to place my takeout order. For this reason I took one star away. When you walk into a restaurant and your not familiar with it someone should recognize your confusion and ask if you need help.<br><br>I got the Chicken Madeira which was delicious. It came with a few Asparagus spears and a ton of mashed potatoes.  The pricing was reasonable and comparable to other restaurants.

2011: I went there with a group of six and we were seated in about 15 minutes on a Thursday evening. Not bad. The atmosphere is kind of Egyptian/Disney-ish, clean, busy but not too loud. Comfortable seating, with adequate privacy. Great food, and an amazing selection.  Our waitress was excellent, friendly, informative and efficient.  And, of course, they have all kinds of cheesecake, which several in our group had, and loved.<br>Update: Our same group went back again this year (2013) and I did not enjoy the food this time. Still a large selection of food, but it was overcooked and several dishes were too sweet (a chicken and a tuna dish), which overpowered the taste of the food, and one raw tuna dish had tuna that was grainy. A lot of carbs: rice, potato etc. filled up the plates. I don&#39;t think I will go back again. The cheesecake was still good though.

I have never had much luck with this location. I returned after not choosing to dine at this establishment for roughly 4 years on 1/19 . My wife and i chose to give it another go after receiving a gift card. I was reminded how bad the menus were after being seated, but eventually decided on an app and entree after searching threw the unappealing menu. We started with nachos that had very little cheese on them. Followed by my wife getting her steak which was fine, and I got chicken carbonara. The first problem was that the carbonara was bland, the second problem was the very small amount of chicken that was there, and the third/worst  problem  it made me sick for several days.  I have just now been able to write this review and would also not recommend this establishment.

I actually went here for a Birthday Dinner for my 18 year old son, his choice.   This was the first time I&#39;ve eaten at this restaurant and I was not impressed.  I think the best part of the meal was the bread.  I ordered The Chicken Piccata and honestly I&#39;ve never had this dish in a thick creamy alfredo type sauce.  I should have returned it when it was served but I didn&#39;t want to make a fuss since it was a special occasion. The dish was very bland, not a hint of lemon and the capers were sparce.  I actually felt sick halfway through my meal and didn&#39;t finish it.  My youngest ordered the steak which was served to her about 15 minutes after everyone else&#39;s dish which was really annoying because we had already waited 45 minutes to be seated and another 30-40 for our meals.  We went during a week night, so I&#39;m not sure that the issue was.  I felt it was extremely expensive for what it was which is basically gourmet fast food.   We ordered desert to go since we had a cake waiting at home.  The Chocolate Tower cake was massive however once again, not impressive, the quantity was there but not the quality that you would expect with the high price.  My stomach ached the entire way home.    I won&#39;t be returning, I&#39;d rather go to a non-chain restaurant and get the quality I&#39;m paying for.

Received excellent service tonight, a Saturday, from Tony our waiter tonight at cheesecake. He was quick to refill an empty glass and checked on us appropriately but not over bearing. Prices are a little high and the size of plates has shrunk somewhat but overall it&#39;s a great location and not a stuffy environment so I enjoy it as a treat every now and then.

Went in for a joint birthday dinner for my stepdads 50th and my brothers 7th birthday since they both fall on the same day.  Our experience was terrible. I called 5 days before our visit to set up a reservation for 12 people and the hostess told me they do not take reservation and to come in 45 minutes before we wish to be seated. Most of us in the party know it would be at least an hour so come Sunday my sister went in to put her name on the list. She was told she would wait minimum 2 hours. She told the hostess that we called and were told to be there 45 before we wished to be seated. My sister told the hostess that we were misinformed and had planned around the information we were given before which is why we did not make a reservation. The hostess told my sister that they do not reservations because it does not benefit the restaurant and that we did not meet their requirements to their policy so we had to wait. The manager was then evolved and showed interest in accommodating us for about 10 minutes. At this point the restaurant was still not busy. He told my sister he would do everything he could to have us sat in an hour and apologized. An hour and a half later we ask the hostess if she had any idea how much longer and she told us they were just waiting for tables to clear so they can be cleaned. At this point everyone in my party was hungry and frustrated as people were coming in and being sat a lot faster then we were. One girl was pregnant and asked for a water which she never received. The manager was no where to be seen and no one came up to us to keep us updated on the status of the tables. After over two hours waiting, we decided we were going to leave. At this point the manager was at the cheesecake station ignoring us and doing work on the POS system. In the 2 hours we waited we were not offered a drink or any thing during our wait. All the staff ignored us and did not try to be friendly with us. We asked about our tables a few times and were answered rudely as if we were being annoying. After almost 2 hours and a half my sister went up to the manager and told him we had waited over two hours and that we were frustrated and we were leaving. Apparently he had forgotten about us because he spoke to my sister as if he had no idea who she was. She repeated back to him what he had told her earlier and said ok has it been that long? she replied with yes its been way longer its been over two hours. He said ok and walked away.
